Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located with a nice/friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AleXTrip009
Reviews.Content: This 2 stars hotel, is has vey good ratio quality/price for Roma, very well located in the city centre, near the Colloseum, close to public transport. The refurbished rooms are modern, spacious, with a nice bathroom. The classic rooms with separated bathroom, are correct and very adequate for a 3 or 4 nights stay. For the breakfast, it is pleasant to have it already included into the room rate, and even if the room is small, the quality is very correct. Last but not least, the staff, is very sympathic, helpful, nice, ... only positive comments on them !

Reviews.Title: “The staff make the experience of staying at this small classic Italian hotel very special”
Reviews.Author: SmithAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough nice things about the staff...all of them...at this small hotel on a side street very near the Termini, a very convenient location. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to help us any way they could. Some of the rooms are small but we were fortunate to have a top floor bedroom that was larger than most and with a balcony that we very much enjoyed. The rooms were very clean with modern conveniences perhaps not found at all hotels in their price range. We choose the option with a private bath and breakfast included for convenience. Given the prices for accommodations in Rome, I thought this hotel was a good bargain. I would most definitely choose to stay there again if for no other reason than the outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “First Knight!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!& amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: darkmoonlight
Reviews.Content: we selected Saturnia, through Trip advisor ratings and we are very glad we did. On arriving we were greeted by the most nice and lovely Concierge we have ever met !he was extremely nice Charming, and helpful. He gave us very helpful, clear instructions and gave us a map showing all the points of interest in the city which was very helpful . that made it very easy for us to see everything. Then helped us with our luggage,also let us use the front desk computer and printer to print our boarding passes for our flight and to book the Vatican museum . he seemed to really like doing his Job, and enjoy doing it!!!!. unfortunately we don't know his name, but he looks like Richard Gere 20 years ago!!!!!!!!!and always smiling, really fantastic also the staff at breakfast were very helpful and attentive. Breakfast itself was very good, there was bread, ham, cheese, and orange juice, cookies, etc. The cappuccinos were delicious , lots of choice, The room was very pleasant and clean. It was truly well worth the price. These are small things which can easily be fixed,But the location, the spotless cleanliness, the atmosphere and the welcome- all make it a wonderful place . The location of the hotel was very convenient ,We walked everywhere from the hotel, all points of interest was within a reasonable distance.We even walked to the Vatican! If you want to buy beer, wine, cheese, bread there are many stores nearby. We checked out and our flight home was late. the hotel looked after our luggage for the day so we could spend the day sightseeing. Everybody who works there really cares for the guests and we were made to feel very welcome. Thanks all Saturnia staff (specially the guy with Richard Gere eyes) We were very sad to leave and look forward to our next visit. We cannot wait to go back Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Raj R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredibly good value for money, the staff were so friendly and went out of their way to help us, recommending places to see and eat. I can honestly say that I have not encountered more friendly staff in any hotel we ve ever stayed. A great family friendly hotel, would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karl M
Reviews.Content: We arrive at Saturnia early in the morning, about 11:00 a.m., and the man at reception advised us that our room was maybe ready. Time for a lovely cappuccino maid from a young lady and as promised our room was ready. We've really appreciated this because for an only two days stay in Rome time is precious. Room are perfect for a couple, all needs are inside. The location is the other advantage of Hotel Saturnia. You can walk everywhere, to Colosseum (amazing), to the Vatican (incredible), to Spanish steps (wonderful) and best shopping area is also 5 minutes walking. At least we recommend this place to all people want to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base to Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Searcher
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. We arrived early and were offered breakfast while our room was cleaned. We received our room at 9:30 AM, which was much earlier than the official check-in. Breakfast was good. Ask for coffee from the lady behind the counter. The room was as advertised, clean and with all the necessities. It was not large by any means, but this is expected in Europe. The hotel is on a side street off of Via Cavour, so the noise was not an issue. Make sure you have the address handy for the cab driver. The front desk was always willing to help with any request. We chose this hotel because of its location to the train station and the metro, proximity to the Forum (and other sites), and cheap eats. I would re-book if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Truth be told.. It's pretty average!”
Reviews.Author: Claire R
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews of this hotel I was fairly excited about the trip and thought my boyfriend had chosen rather well! However it's fair to say that I was underwhelmed and quite disappointed. LOCATION The hotel has a relatively central location, within walking distance of the main sights, however any hotel in the city centre boasts this trait! You don't need to stay at the Saturnia for that! STAFF The reviews on hear state that the hotel staff are outstanding.. I'd have to disagree I'm afraid. On arrival the hotel staff were not overly welcoming, and after attempting to ask where a nice restaurant would be for dinner (and getting no help!) we quickly developed a bad impression of them. This was somewhat rectified the following morning when one of the staff members kindly helped us find our feet and plan our route around Rome. However this was the only time that we saw him and the rest of the staff just weren't up to the same standard. ROOM We had a standard double room. However it was not a double, it was two single beds pushed together. Now I work for a Travel Agent and I understand that this trait is applicable in Europe as you often get two beds pushed together BUT this should only occur when you book a 'standard room' if the room type is stated as DOUBLE that is exactly what it should be. One of the beds was also damaged, the shower broken and the heating in the room failed to work. FOOD The breakfast at the hotel was awful. I'm sorry but there's no other way to describe it. They had croissants, ham and coffee. That really was the extent of the breakfast. Needless to say I only ate the breakfast once. ROME IN GENERAL Rome however is amazing! And I'd recommend it to anyone! Beautiful city and so much to see! Me and my boyfriend went from the 3rd of February - 6th February and we experienced Rome in the snow which was so pretty! Unfortunately a lot of the attractions were closed due to the freak weather, but hey, how often does in snow in Rome?! Makes for amazing photos! :) TOP TIP: There are some amazing little restaurants near the Trevi Fountain definately worth a try, Al Picchio was our favourite. OVERALL I would recommend Rome to anyone! I just wouldn't recommend the Saturnia. If you're looking for a cheap but lovely little hotel perhaps look at the Columbia or the Amalfi (excellent 3* stars) or if you're looking for something more upmarket try the Capo D'Africa (4*+ stars).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: CarrieinDenver
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Saturnia for business for four days in January. This little hotel is a wonderful find and great place to stay. It is certainly small and simple, but I would absolutely recommend it to anyone. The staff are incredible and made me feel like I was in my own home. They could not have been more accommodating. The location of the hotel is also ideal as it's within walking distance of the Stazione Termini and the Colosseum. Its location right off Via Cavour makes it easy to find without having all the noise that a large street brings. If I were to ask for any improvement, it would be the breakfast. It was very basic and certainly not bad, but I would have appreciated some fresh fruit. However, this is a minor complaint. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel, huge service!”
Reviews.Author: Pedro C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to most historical sites as Il Colosseum, Fontana di Trevi, Forum and the metro/train station. It is a very good choice as it is not expensive and it is really worth it! The service is awesome, the receptionists are very kind and help you in anything you need, specially Alessandro, a 22 year-old man born in Rome. This is a hotel I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice basic hotel. Central to all main sights”
Reviews.Author: C4er
Reviews.Content: We had a single room with double bed/bathroom on the first floor overlooking the side street. The room was small but was clean and tidy - just what we wanted for a 3 night stay. Our room was overlooking the side street and although we left the windows open, we didnt experince any noise from the street, it was pretty quiet. The breakfast lacked a little - coffee wasnt very nice, neither was the choice of food but was adequate to start the day. Reception staff were friendly and overall a very nice hotel if you just want somewhere to sleep. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the colloseum and about 20 minutes to Trevi fountain. We caught the Metro to the Vatican but it wasnt a very nice experience so we walked back to the hotel from the Vatican and saw some lovely sights that we wouldnt have know about if we had caught the metro. Took us about an hour to walk back. Also the hotel is only about 15 mins from Termini station and has a few metro stops around. I would definately recommend this hotel due to its location. Lots of nice restaurants nearby and everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “sin go home”
Reviews.Author: angus670
Reviews.Content: we were very good in this hotel, where we found staff friendly and reliable. our room was on a mezzanine floor and there was no lift, but the very friendly Mr. Virgilio accompanied us and brought us our very heavy suitcases. advised us where to eat our meals and how to visit the tourist areas. we hope to return soon

Reviews.Title: “a good place”
Reviews.Author: arild b
Reviews.Content: small hotel in a good position to rome. very convenient to be able to visit the city, very close to the train station and bus station. Staff very efficient for a good cleaning. typical Italian breakfast, but Buna, also good coffee and juice or chocolate. a good appreciation for Mr. Virgilio

Reviews.Title: “Just Don't”
Reviews.Author: kingstupka
Reviews.Content: Its a little difficult to write this because the people running the desk at this establishment were very nice and I feel a little badly for them. I felt worse for myself after having slept here for a few nights and the point of this site is for people to get real opinions. I've travelled all over Europe and North America and have never seen a hotel this bad. I have slept in cabanas and tents on beaches in Mexcio and am not a princess by any stretch of the imagination. The rooms were dirty, the mattress 20 years old, the floors made of laminate that were extremely noisy all night long. The floor in the room was actually partially tile and partially laminate with big gaps in between. The windows were uninsulated and the street noise was terrible. There was no thermostat to control the heat. This entire hotel needs to be redone and maybe should close until then. The doors to the rooms and the baths don't open fully; they hit the raised floors and scrape along. The pillows were the flattest I had ever seen and when we asked for extras, the ones we received were so old and dirty I was afraid to use them. Half of the outlets in the room did not work which mad me wonder about the wiring. The shower had no shelves for your soap and shampoo and was about 18 inches wide. For the price, I did not expect much, actually our expectations were extremely low but we were still dissappointed. I could go on but overall it was so bad it seems silly to go into every detail. This place might be okay for the backpacking crowd if they can get a bed for less than $20 a night that they will likely not use much. There are much better places for the same money very close by. If you are tempted, just don't, trust me. A place this bad can really ruin your vacation as if you can't sleep, you will not have the energy to see all the amazing sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: SamT1801
Reviews.Content: As this was a last minute holiday I was quite concerned as to what our accommodation would be like. My sister and I chose this hotel as it had good reviews and was said to be in a very good location. These reviews did not let us down. The rooms (although very basic) were clean, the location was fantastic, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We found ourselves out for the entire day enjoying the sights of Rome and so only needed somewhere to sleep. This Hotel definitely served the purpose. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is only looking for a hotel that is reasonably priced, good location, but away from the hustle and bustle. It is also a 10 minute walk from the Termini, so easily accessed from the airport without using too many modes of transport. Breakfast was average but it is Rome so you tend to eat a lot of Pizza in the day anyway. I hope this helps to anyone looking to go to this amazing city. Enjoy Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic we paid for the price. The walk to the coliseum took about 10 - 15 minutes and it was not that far from the main train station. The hotel staff were so friendly and the best thing about the breakfast was that when you wanted a coffee they made it there and then for you to go with your breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay here and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor is broken”
Reviews.Author: m c
Reviews.Content: I placed a search in Trip Advisor for the best hotel in Rome - business purposes - located near the main city train station and the number 1 result was this pile called the Saturnia. The room was so small...... ( how small was it?! ) that i could barely open the door before smacking the flophouse era bed. The toilet was so small.....( how small was it??) that I could barely squat to enjoy my morning constitutional before banging my knees on the pathetic excuse for a shower stall.... Breakfast was a treat - they had a monster cappucino machine with a snarly lady who said that there was no such thing as a cafe latte The good news was that they had an automated crappocino machine as an optional alternative for lousy espresso but without the attitude. Overall: Overpriced and only good for a quickie with a Tuscan Ho Shame on Trip Advisor for letting this one get the #1 ranking Rank

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kerstin b
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days at the hotel saturnia, although is very small and old construction, lacked the necessary comfort. breakfast was included in the price and was plentiful and varied. last year, the Concierge, Mr. virgilio, before going to the concert offered us sparkling wine to toast the arrival of the new year. upon return, about four, we were cold and offered us a good hot tea, hoping a good year, we were really good.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: pancay
Reviews.Content: I was with my family saturnia hotel, we enjoyed the Roman culture very different from our own habits, educational archaeological, rome is wonderful, beautiful, and has been for us to be an emotion on Roman soil. see the monuments so ancient it's exciting. Our hotel, small but efficient for comfort. Mr. tiziano and Mr. Virgilio, friendly and kind to our requests. breakfast to Mrs. lilly very helpful. were it not for the distance, we will return willingly.

Reviews.Title: “amazing journey”
Reviews.Author: nancy f
Reviews.Content: thought for a long time to grant a holiday in Rome, but we have postponed many times. This hotel gave us a good room with a bathroom at a great low price. The breakfast was typical European, but all very fresh and plentiful. the staff were very friendly, even Miss Mikela. great staff in reception, thanks to Mr. Virgilio very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: StephCain
Reviews.Content: The service at Hotel Saturnia was top-notch, especially for a small hotel. Everyone was kind and spoke English as well as Italian. The front desk employees could answer all sorts of questions, from where to buy wine to the shortcut to the Metro. The breakfast was the standard European hotel breakfast, but the items were fresh and they hotel had a barista making fresh espresso, americano, and cappucino. Sure beats the automatic machines!

Reviews.Title: “Errmmm...”
Reviews.Author: puxadoraz
Reviews.Content: This is a rather difficult review to write. I was swayed to try this hotel by all the wonderful reviews it received by other travellers on Tripadvisers. I did not read the room description and missed the fact that it offers shared bathroom facilities - no wonder the room was so cheap! If you are adventurous enough to share bathrooms that are not sparkling clean with starngers, you should be okay with staying there for a few nights. BUT, the beds are soft, and is not conducive to a good night's sleep. You are screwed if, like my partner, you have back problems. Breakfast was okay, nothing to rave about. Staff was polite and nice. Location is not very great, you have to walk a distance from the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: Geetanjali85
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in August 2011 and stayed at hotel Saturnia. The rooms were quite small and felt very dark. You can hear people climbing the stairs or talking. It is close to Roma Termini and two other metro stations which is why we probably chose it. It is also close to the Colosseum and there are enough places to eat nearby. The location is good but we didn't really like the hotel and our room. We'd prefer to try a different hotel when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: taimot t
Reviews.Content: conveniently located for any displacement. Welcoming staff. small rooms. Riccardo very kind to recommend restaurants, Michela and Palmira carine either in the breakfast room which in cleaning the room. Thanks to the hospitality and kindness of Mr. Virgilio, in particular the art exhibited in this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomadEurope
Reviews.Content: This was not our first visit to Rome but one of the best. Best because we stayed at a reasonably priced hotel but with a 5 star service. The Saturnia had everything that we could wish for; helpful staff, clean room and good breakfast and our requests were genuinely attended to. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: jhonsoon m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel very convenient for visiting Rome. We visited the city on foot. The links were very indicative. Rome is wonderful at night, thanks to the indications given by Mr. Virgil to availability and we came back at three in the morning. Breakfast can be done until ten o'clock. Mrs. Michela is very courteous. The downside of this hotel is that it has no elevator and some noise in the work to improve the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value, but noisy halls, neighbors”
Reviews.Author: kingbobIII
Reviews.Content: Pros: 10-minute walk to train station, Colosseum, and 15-20 minute walk to many wonderful Roman plazas; nice breakfast with terrific cappucino; friendly, accommodative staff; upscale decor; quiet street; private sink/mirror. Good base for all of Rome's sights. Cons: 2 of our 3 nights here, we were seriously disturbed by noise from neighbors at all hours. The rooms evidently have little sound insulation. And, because we had a shared bathroom, we could frequently hear others using the facilities in the middle of hte night. Also, because the bathroom was shared by at least 3 rooms, I suggest they clean it more multiple times a day. Other cons: A tight room, even for Italy, and a b'dei at the foot of the bed (strange and seemingly unsanitary); no elevator or assistance to carry luggage up 3 narrow flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ESBurr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnia was a really good place to stay in Rome. The staff was incredibly helpful, the rooms were clean and had everything I needed. Price was reasonable. I'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “long live the pizza”
Reviews.Author: lilly t
Reviews.Content: really good hotel. very nice to see Rome in pleasant walks. services offered are functional, good wifi, good cleaning staff. Mr. Virgilio advised that good for us a good pizza, white hen, where we enjoyed pizza Buna. we will return.

Reviews.Title: “a good holiday”
Reviews.Author: loreen s
Reviews.Content: because it was a good holiday hotel Saturnia is very good location for walking to visit Rome. Saturnia is a comfortable hotel has good clean and good breakfast. staff very polite and kind. Mr. Virgil thanks for great restaurants and tips

Reviews.Title: “Good location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: janet r
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnia was walking distance to all main attractions and close to great restaurants. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was good and the latte/cappuccino/hot chocolate machine is available free of charge all day. There is no elevator, so getting large bags to the third floor is challenging. The double room with a shared bathroom was small but cozy. The shared bathroom was a little run down. Overall, had a pleasant stay due to the location and staff. Would stay here again on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR SOLO TRAVELER ON A BUDGET!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpartiGreeceMichael
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome on November 7-10 as a solo traveler and wanted a cheap descent hotel for a couple of hours rest and a good night sleep.Based on trip advisor reviews, I chose Saturnia and through its official website chose a single basic room with shared bathroom for only 29.58 euros per night! (add 2 euros per night Rome City Tax) which was a real bargain!The hotel is close to Roma Termini rail station on foot (about 10 minutes) just follow Via Cavour and after you see the Santa Maria Maggiore church on your left, turn the first right on the small via Ruinaglia. The reception men are very polite and willing to help on every need. Ricardo that I talked mostly, replaced immediately the tv set that was not working properly, gave me guidelines and suggested a closeby restaurant with very good prices(pasta 6 euros). My room (room 210 second floor) was small but adequate for one person, clean, one window, overlooking the small Via Ruinaglia and a bit of Via Cavour with double glass, so you could hear no noise at night and sleep deeply!It has a wash basin and the toilet-bathroom is at the end of the corridor and it is clean and perfect for a shower.They provide towels and soap-shampoo.Breakfast served 7-10 am is continental and has a choise of fresh croissants (go at 7.00 to catch the best) and a coffe machine with a choise of 6 hot drinks.The location is perfect for exploring the sights of central Rome on foot.There is a small super market at the end of Via Urbana (3minutes on foot) so you can buy basics in good price (e.g. bottle of new season wine "novello" for 1.79 euros) Overall hotel Saturnia met my expectations and contibruted to my pleasant three days trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We found a good service”
Reviews.Author: jonathan w
Reviews.Content: our stay in this hotel was very nice. we arrived very late, but the keeper, Mr. Virgil has been very kind to us, and offered to carry our luggage and show our camera.abbiamo found everything very clean, the bathroom that we shared with others. the breakfast was good, Italian, but abbondante.la morning of our departure Mr. Virgil has prepared a great breakfast even though the schedule was too early. really thanks

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem in the centre of Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lita L
Reviews.Content: Rome overall was an incredible experience for me, much due specifically to Hotel Saturnia! The staff was incredibly lovely and attentive as well as patient, and helped me find my way around, give me insight on what to do and see, and actually made me feel so at home at the end of each day. I literally walked everywhere from the hotel, they are that centrally located! My room was a single basic and although I had to share a bathroom, I was given this choice in advance and everything was so clean! The staff not only looks after this place as though they own it but they really enjoy people and love their city. Breakfast was big, with lots of selection, and I enjoyed many espressos during my stay there. Many many thanks to to Alejandro and Virgilio specifically, but an overall kudos to all the staff. I cannot wait to go back to Rome and I will definitely book Hotel Saturnia in advance. Highly, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a very convenient location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hummingbirdy
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time in Rome, and part of it was this cozy hotel. It is very conveniently located close to the train station, you can save money and walk from it (you will be able to catch train to/from the airport as well). Alessandro was so attentive and gave great recommendations to the restaurants and places to see. I initially had some technical problems booking the hotel online and we kept writing emails to each other but the management was very courteous and held the room for us for a few days even without having my credit card information (until I was able to submit it properly). Our room was very clean, nice and big, we even got lucky to have a good view. Breakfast was basic but good to have before a busy day of sightseeing. This place is perfect for budget or value travelers so I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B, great staff, geat breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: david f
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, the whole staff was warm and friendly. The owners Tiziano and Riccardo helped me at every turn. I had a nice air-conditioned room which is really needed in August. The breakfast was outstanding and made available even when I was late. Coffee is always available for free. The hotel is within walking distance of most attractions. Pleasant owners and staff make a hotel experience really worth-while. I for sure will stay there again. Rome is the place to study art. David Fugere, davidfugereart.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: smon g
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night only because our intended hotel had a plumbing problem,and they asked if we'd mind staying here for one night. what really makes this hotel special is the hospitality of the staff, especially trizano, who was extremely helpful & friendly. (He turned down my offer of a tip, saying it was his pleasure to be of help). The hotel rooms are clean and have all you need if you, like me just used it as a base to stay. It's just a short walk to the coloseum, 20>25 mins walk to the treivi fountain, 30mins to the Spanish steps & maybe about 45mins walk to the Vatican. there is a metro station close to the hotel. I would definately reccomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: We even discovered a Basilica right around the corner! Saint Pudenziana's Basilica which has a lot of interesting history. We purchased the booklet for 3 euro. This hotel and staff were completely wonderful! We had a great first floor room, not 0, and our own bathroom. PS - at each hotel in Italy I asked for the best room since we were celebrating our anniversary. The breakfast was fantastic! The gal who made us our coffee each day was so nice and she actually cleans the rooms too! We stayed for 3 nights and walked everywhere.....found a fun Irish pub - Druid's Rock and ate a few blocks away one night at a wonderful restaurant which was recommended to us from friends here - Ristorante Fulvimari (closed Sundays).

Reviews.Title: “The only good part was the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: abeille323
Reviews.Content: We had one bad experience after another at Hotel Saturnia. First, we arrived at the hotel only to have them tell us they had to send us to another hotel for a night because of some problems with the room. They assured us that the other hotel was of comparable quality, but it turned out to be even worse than Saturnia (see Hotel Tre Stelle reviews)! When we returned to Saturnia, we were given the smallest hotel room we had even seen, even by European standards. There was barely room to walk around the bed to the bathroom, let alone having space for our suitcases. The bathroom was similarly tiny, with a toilet, bidet, shower and sink all crammed into a room that could not have been more than 4 feet by 4 feet. We couldn't turn around without smacking into something. The bathroom also smelled awful, as though there was mold and mildew growing out of control. The shower was tiny & the shower curtain was broken and didn't cover the whole area so water went everywhere. There was no bath mat so we had to use one of our hand towels to mop up the mess. To make things worse, the toilet seat broke the first night we were there (and we are not large people - 140 lbs each). They told us they would fix it but didn't until the last day of our stay. It was also extremely noisy at night if anyone was talking outside the hotel. We could hear a man across the street from inside his apartment. It was ridiculous. This hotel is a terrible value for money in my opinion. We paid 129 euros a night and I have stayed in cheaper places in Rome in the past and had much better experiences. The only real positives this place has going for it (other than proximity to Termini Station) are the food options. The breakfast at the hotel was reasonably tasty and included enough food to fill us up until lunch (hardboiled eggs, ham, cheese, buns, pastries, cereal & yogurt). There is also a great gelato place around the corner called Gelateria Santa Maria Maggiore. If you choose to stay at Saturnia against my advice, you will likely need to drown your sorrows in a cup or two of gelato and Gelateria Santa Maria Maggiore is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Roma Termini and Colusseum”
Reviews.Author: HungryJack32
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay at the hotel. Make sure you know how to get to the hotel....we walked from the termini station (which is super close), but we arrived very late at night and the street names are not easy to read (this was true all around Rome, street names are etched into building sides) and we would have walked past the short little street it's on had I not seen pics of the outside of the hotel on this site. Hotel staff is super nice, very accommodating and knowledgable. Wifi worked great in the room and was included. Breakfast was also included and was not the best (not a ton of selection and pastries weren't wonderful) but over the few days were there I figured out what I liked and it was enough to get me going till a late lunch (plus they will make you little cappuccinos). Hotel seemed typical for Rome for the price...in an old building, no A/C in our room (although the fan we had helped when the window was open), close to noisy street (but once we closed the window the noise reduced significantly). Our room in particular was a little bizarre. We had a shared bathroom, which ended up meaning just a toilet down the hall because our room had a shower in the corner. Was not private so might be awkward for 2 friends, but was fine for me and my husband. There are minimal room amenities (no hair dryer, no safe, no coffee maker). However, it was very clean and safe, and someone came to clean everyday. I would stay here again for the value and we were about a 20-25min walk from everything except the Vatican, which took us a 40min. to get to walking speedily (found out metro was on strike so we had to book it to the Vatican for our tour). So if you plan to spend minimal time in the room and want to be able to walk everywhere (metro/buses are very close too) it's a good deal. But if you are more comfortable in a hotel with more amenities and more modern, don't kid yourself, pay more to stay somewhere else (but it'll be expensive I bet).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: sciscio
Reviews.Content: I was here for 4 nights at the beginning of the summer with my girlfriend. The first night we were given a very small room (one of those some other posters complain about), but as soon as we asked for a bigger room they immediately accommodated us. Make sure you get a room not facing Viale Cavour, as they are very quite. The managers are very nice; we felt well taken care every moment we were there. The rooms are not perfect, but they are clean, and the price and location are great for what you get. I would go back there in a heart beat! The buffet breakfast is wonderful, especially considering how stingy places in Rome can be. All considered, I found this place to be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great service”
Reviews.Author: RomaPHILE33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saturnia in August and September. August is very hot and it is true that you can't sleep without the windows closed and the airconditioning on, but that's the result of its location being so central. It is right near the Via Cavour equidistant from Termini and Cavour stations. The rooms we stayed in were small but the hotel is an older style hotel and installing the bathrooms reduced the original size of the rooms. There is basically enough room to walk around the bed and the bathroom is very small however the beds were comfortable and clean, the rooms were well maintained and the bathrooms were reliable and clean. It's a base for exploring Rome. What makes this hotel is the quality of the staff. Tiziano is friendly, helpful, efficient and impossibly handsome! Michaela who runs the hotel from the breakfast room, views everything that goes on with a smile playing about her lips. Vergilio, who mostly was on nightshift when we were there, painted the paintings (in a sort of school of Caravaggio style) in the hotel. These people will bend over backwards to make your stay in Rome memorable. They aren't just doing a job, they behave as if you are someone they know and they really care about making your stay enjoyable. The staff all work together as a team and really seem to get on well together. Breakfast is good and the coffee is really enjoyable. The facilities are basic but good but the staff are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I never stayed in - I can't believe the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: troy k
Reviews.Content: Please read this review before booking! I've stayed in some pretty seedy Super 8 hotels in the US and similar low cost hotels in Canada, and I've been to England, Ireland, the Netherlands and Cuba before - and have never left a hotel and taken a loss (388 Euro) before. My wife's last trip to Italy she stayed in hostels. I made the mistake of prepaying to save a little money which meant I was stuck. This was supposed to be the 3rd hotel in our Italy trip (stayed in 5 other hotels total, all good) but this one was so bad that my wife (we were on our honeymoon) literally sat on the bed and cried. We were supposed to have a double bed, air conditioning and a private bath, but when we got there the clerk (who was actually very nice, no complaint there) said that for the 1st night at least they'd have to give us a room for four as it was the only room they had left (really it was the only room with air conditioning and a private bath left). I asked if we had to move our stuff the next day and he said if we wanted to we could stay in the room for all 3 nights - at first, I thought wow we lucked out and got a bigger room. Well, the room wasn't actually in the hotel, he lead us out into the alley (the picture doesn't show it, but the hotel entrance is really in an alley) and opened a metal gate and walked down the stairs into the basement where he opened the door to our room - a decent size room with a bath and air conditioning, but NO windows, no other exit (so it was a fire hazard and wouldn't even be legal in NA, not sure about Italy but I assume it is), and the stench was absolutely unbelievable. It smelled as if they poured a few litres of cheap perfume in the room to cover up the smell of the mold. Although my wife has asthma I've never in two years seen it act up, but it did when we went into this room. So we asked if there were any other rooms and he said he had one that had no air conditioning and no toilet but we could have that. We decided to change rooms but the heat and noise from the other room was just too much. We told the bell clerk we couldn't stay and would have to leave and find something else. He urged us to come back the next day since the room was already paid for and he'd have another room available but really once we found another hotel and got settled it would have been a pain to have to only get the other hotel for one night in hopes that they had anything better (which I'm highly doubtful of) - and if they didn't we'd have to go find another hotel again. What a mess. Besides what I've mentioned above, I don't think the rooms in the hotel have been updated in 30 years or more. The lobby looked fine as did the breakfast area, but the two rooms we saw were awful. Here's the kicker - about 2 blocks away we found a Relais hotel, 4 stars, the Antico Palazzo Rospigliosi Hotel and the regular price of 130 Euros was the same as the discounted price at Saturnia. Do yourself a favor, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita!”
Reviews.Author: mary c
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and booked the hotel through www.entertainment.com/expedia. My companion and I got a room with twin beds. Plenty of room for the two of us and our large luggages. Perfect location to everywhere. We saw 80% of everything on the map in 4 days. The guys that work there are terrific. Tizianno and Francesco are so helpful! Very close to the Termini station. A short walk up the street. We didn't know that and a taxi driver charged us $25 euros. Getting to the airport, the guys booked a driver for only $40 euros. Tizianno also booked us a spot for the Borghese Museum. I would highly recommend it. The breakfast every morning was great too. The guys will make you a fresh espresso or capochino. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Jockluva
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reasonably priced hotel close to the Central Station for two nights. The Hotel Saturnia fit the bill perfectly. It was a ten minute walk just off Via Cavour. My room was spacious and included a shower, bidet and (cracked) sink. It was not air conditioned but a large electric fan was provided, though it was missing its protective cover. The toilet was down the hall way. The staff were all friendly, pleasant and spoke good English. The small breakfast room was intimate and the breakfast was good. There is no lift so be prepared to lug your suitcases. The room window faced Via Cavour which is very busy and noisy and had to be closed at night. The hotel is excellently located for sight seeing being walking distance to the Colosseum and Palatine and a plethora of sight seeing buses.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, quiet location, worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: LauraV1215
Reviews.Content: Upon researching hotels to stay at in Rome, I came across Hotel Saturnia. Location and price were ideal. After a few emails to confirm 2 rooms would be available next to each other for our stay, I proceeded with booking. Due to extraordinary circumstances, I was able to book the first double room, but when I went to book the 2nd room....not available! I was going nuts, worried about the deposit and what to do. I emailed and Ricardo - bless his heart - called me! He apologized for the inconvenience and was able to credit my card without any penalty. We then opted to have all 4 of us stay in the quad room. AMAZING! Large room in Italy for what I have been used to, large bathroom, gorgeous terrace, mini fridge in the room and cute little breakfast room. They were all so kind and accommodating. Even when my mom's suitcase broke they offered to pay for the cab to the hotel. This is a quaint hotel, located on a quiet street (note - not all of the cab drivers knew where it was located so be sure to have the name and address handy at all times as well as a map). Restaurants weren't that plentiful, but easily walkable to the Colosseum. I recommend this place and the quad room! Tell Ricardo hi :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Colosseum (rooms are a bit small though)”
Reviews.Author: BullzEyezz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the staff is extremely friendly. It's a 5min walk from the hotel to the Colosseum. 5min walk from the main metro station (Termini) and 2min walk from another metro station (Cavour). The hotel was perfect as I was on a backpacking trip, the rooms are a bit small so is the bathroom but it didn't bother me at all. Would definitely stay there again if I go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiermaBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for copule of days and we found the location perfect.the room was great, spacius and clan with Air condition and free wifi.the people at the reception were professional and very helpful. The breakfast was good,fresh coffee eggs boiled chees ham etc. I'd still definetely reconmend it as it was the perfect base for our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vista7777
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within easy walking distance of the major sites and metro. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They suggested a great restaurant to us that served amazing pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: ferenzliszt
Reviews.Content: After arrival we got a double room without toilet, a shower was placed inside the room one about 1,5 meter from the bed. As we didn't make reservation for a shared toilet, we went to the frontoffice clerk. When we complained about this, they said it would only be for one night. The clerk didn't understand why we did not want to accept it as it was only for one night. Our money was not refundable and they finally offered a very small room. It had no double bed, as we reserved, but only a twin. Tired from the journey we accepted it. We better should have not. The room was extreme noisy. At night we could hear everyone coming in. But it also had fungus in the bathroom, doornobs fell off, the safe was unusable, 2 lights did not work and it had a little fridge that didn't work properly. But the worst thing was the night clerk who had his friends over during the nights and had loud conversations below our window. We didn't sleep 4 out of the 7 nights. When we made reservation this hotel had about nr 90 in the tripadvisor scale, but to our opinion it should be about nr 900! To my opinion a hotel should be about 3 main things: 1) clean 2) gives you a good night sleep 3) location The location is okay, but the others....well...

Reviews.Title: “convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Andytt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near to the city's train station, about 10 minute's walk. Friendly staff. I checked in to a single bed room, there was no city view from room window but hey, it's cheap and value for money and location is in middle of city, so not a problem for me. My room has a small TV and wardrobe, just basic facility. Nice and comfortable place to stay if you just want a place to sleep in your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Saturnia gets top marks because of the amazing hospitality!!!”
Reviews.Author: islanders_709
Reviews.Content: We were initially booked into the sister hotel of Saturnia but upon arrival realized there had been an issue with our booking (to no fault of the hotel). As it was our first time visiting Rome we were crushed about the booking error. The Hotel receptionist (who works between both locations) really went over and above in helping to get us get booked into Saturnia last minute. The continued hospitality of the hotel staff was so refreshing. What a great experience! Because we were booked in last minute we did end up staying in 2 different rooms. Night 1 we were in a room with 3 single beds. It seemed spacious enough for 3. For the next 3 nights we stayed in a double room on the top floor. The floor is up a very small spiral staircase but it has a little outdoor terrace! What a treat!! The bathrooms are tiny but we had our own ensuite so were happy. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dobrá lokalita za nízkou cenu”
Reviews.Author: Tereza D
Reviews.Content: Hotel se nám líbil po všech stránkách a mile nás překvapil. Velmi dobrá lokalita, příjemní recepční, čisté pokoje. Každý den vyměňují ručníky a uklízí pokoj, což je velkou výhodou. Jediná nevýhoda je hluk z ulice, ale jak jsme mohli pozorovat, tak prakticky všechny hotely v centru města leží na velmi rušných ulicích a ani více * Vám nezajistí klid. Snídaně byly dostačující. Všechno předčilo naše očekávání.

Reviews.Title: “Aircon needed!!”
Reviews.Author: Phvin
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights in August. Great price but the only advice I can offer is make sure you get a room with aircon even if it costs more. You can't sleep with the window open thanks to the noise outside from city life (Restuarant, sirens,notions etc) and the fan I had in my room was very noisy so it was a case of which poison was going to keep me awake. The single rooms are extremely small but I found this a motivation not to sit in my room as I was there to see the sites. Enough of the bad, the good; service was extremely good (worthy of a 5 star), very clean, centrally located, free wifi, tasty breakfast. Would I stay there again? Yes, but if in summer only if I could get a room with aircon. Rest is probably the most important aspect you need to rate a hotel on and unfortuantely me being a light sleeper (ear plugs req), I left Rome more tired than I got there. Although I suppose some of the blame rests with Ibiza....

Reviews.Title: “Nice with amazing staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pit P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, making access to any part of the city very easy - located just near Colosseum, everything is within walking distance. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a very friendly guy who gave me a map and showed me all the points of interest in the city which was very helpful. Throughout our stay, all the staff were very kind and helpful which made our stay all the more pleasant. The room was a great size and provided all we needed - we had a private bathroom which was newly built & very clean, a comfortable double bed, air conditioning and a TV with a few English channels. For the very reasonable price we paid, we couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “small but functional”
Reviews.Author: lau-bert c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small, but it doesn't miss to be functional. And' near the station of the trains and with a walk I can reach the most meaningful places in Rome. The breakfast has satisfied me as also the cleaning of my room. The personnel is cordial and I has been able to speak my language. A regard to the Signor Virgilio

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: aboard89
Reviews.Content: After spending a horrible couple of nights in a hotel in Blois before coming to Rome, I was a bit worried about coming to the hotel Saturnia. However there was no need for worrying because the Hotel Saturnia was perfect. We were greeted by Alesandro (one of the employees there) who couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The location was great, the breakfast buffet was very good and the staff are amazing. I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 day stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizblan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The quality of service we had there was unbeatable. Very polite and helpful staff. The room we stayed in was a double, with the coldest air conditioner we have encountered in all of Europe, which blew our minds because in the two months we have been in Italy, we haven't been in an air conditioned room. The room was a bit small, but we only needed it for sleep. There was also a mini fridge in the room. The hotel is very centralized. Ten to fifteen minutes walking to all the sites, three minute walk to the Termini station, and the hotel very close to two different Metro stations. Overall, we loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations low, and you'll be okay”
Reviews.Author: Breukleen
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the staff is friendly and attentive, and you get a decent breakfast and free wi-fi. The location is convenient, as you are a few blocks away from Termini bus terminal. However, the hotel decor and standard are probably from 1970's, and not in a good way. Our room, number 212, came with two floor-standing fans and old tv set. The sheets were clean, and the bed was okay. The room faced the main street, and you either had the option to close the windows and suffocate, or leave it open at night, and hear the loud street noise. I should have known that something wasn't right when I booked it, since it was advertised as a room with a shared bathroom, but I must say that the TripAdvisor ranking of this place as a #1 for business travel in Rome let my guard way down. There must be better options in Rome for the money, and those who were raving about this hotel make me wonder what other places they must have stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Fine...”
Reviews.Author: taytayalis
Reviews.Content: This place satisfied our requirements - a bed to sleep on, a toilet to pee in, breakfast, and walking distance to Colosseum and train station. Beyond that, it was not terrible and not extraordinary. The staff was nice and breakfast was fine. But they had no elevator and our room was on the fourth floor. And our shared bathroom needed a renovation...about five years ago. Beware that Rome forces the hotel to charge an extra tax in cash for staying at a hotel (one euro per star per person per night). Just in case you are on a tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “It just felt Italian...”
Reviews.Author: setter1vb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in June and the only two things I could say negative about the place were a faulty AC unit (which they replaced before we left - issue solved) and the small size of the room (however based on other experiences in Europe in the past, this was not a surprise). We were greeted with a smile each day, most of the staff was very amicable to speaking other than Italian as needed, free wi/fi, and a free breakfast in the morning. The front desk bent over backwards to make certain you had anything you needed that they could provide. Location was only a 10 minute walk to Termini and was easy to find even for someone who had never been to Rome. There are certainly higher end hotels, however for the price, Saturnia was the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: mgg222
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, on a quiet kindof street, clean, the free breakfast was amazing each morning, the hotel staff was so unbelievably nice and helpful. We loved our visit to Roma because of our hotel staff and our great experience with our hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to come back again and again and stay at Saturnia!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but EXTREMY warm room!”
Reviews.Author: meliscl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is middle class in centre of Rome. On arrival they gave us a room with a shared bathroom, and we booked a private bathroom, they also gave us the option of another hotel 7km away, which is a bit strange. No parking near hotel! The room was big but EXTREMELY hot with a fan on!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kfarnham
Reviews.Content: Awesome location right next to the train station and subway. The room was really big but was more than enough. The hotel staff spoke English and was great. Breakfast was really good and there was a ton of food. Some of the reviews of the hotel have not been as good and I have no idea why this place was a great value and totally clean and again in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: actus0rea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing--I can't think of anything to criticize, really. My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights as a side trip during our study abroad session in Firenze. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, too. The second we checked in, they gave us a map and circled the main sites, which were within walking distance. The Trevi Fountain, Colliseum/forum, and the Scalinata di Spagna were all within easy walking distance. The Pantheon and Piazza Navona were a little farther out, but still walkable (20-30 minutes walking, I'd say, if you took your time.) The only thing not easily reachable was the Vatican, but the front desk gave us all the metro information and bus info we could need, again marking the map. The train station and Santa Maria Maggiore were about five minutes away as well. The rooms are very comfortable, and most of all spotless. I'm a big cleanliness person, so that was a big plus for me. The room was a bit small, but we were nowhere near cramped or uncomfortable. I thought it was cozy, haha! The bathroom was small too, but new and very very clean. The breakfast was good too. Via Ruinaglia is right off of via Cavour, a main road with lots of restaurants and shops. It's also close to a more local-feeling street with little boutique restaurants, and a cheap internet cafe. It was quite a convenient spot! We'd stay again, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSpez
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. The hotel has a great location, walking distance to lots of places, and the Metro. Our rooms were a good size for two people, and everything was extremely clean. Every staff member was so helpful, we felt extremely lucky. I would stay here again, no hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended and value for money”
Reviews.Author: lynetteUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following the reviews on trip advisor and have absolutely no complaints. We had a twin room - it was clean and well presented. The hotel is in a great location - just off the main road, with metro nearby and all of the attractions are within walking distance. We stayed for 5 days, breakfast was good quality - a typical continental breakfast, staff were helpful and friendly. As with all the hotels in Rome - the roads outside are noisy at all hours however the room has air conditioning so it was easy to keep the window closed and that completely blocked out the noise. If we were going back to Rome we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and dirty - never again!”
Reviews.Author: montymamma
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived, we were told that we had two choices of rooms, either on the fourth floor (no elevator) or the one outside the hotel next door. The one next door, was underground with no windows,no minibar and dirty. We decided to see the one on the fourth floor. We had to walk up three flights and then take narrow spiral stairs for the fourth. When we finally got there, the room was extremely tiny and dark, so we decided on the outside one. Because this room was close to ground level, i the sounds of the street were amplified. Being a New Yorker this really did not bother me too much, what really kept me up was how dirty it was. I could not wait to leave, luckily we were only there for one night to take a flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeaofCyn
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose this centrally located hotel. We slept-in and missed breakfast! Front desk staff were wonderful with thorough directions and his English helped us find our way! Room was spacious and just right for 2 of us. When I'm in Italy next time, and I hope that's soon, I'd stay here again :o)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient 10 minutes walk from central train station. OK for the money for Roma”
Reviews.Author: aristo777
Reviews.Content: My expectation for Roma hotels following 2 stays are not too high, so this one was OK considering my reduced expectation. Convenient if you arrive/depart Roma by train (about 10 minutes walking west-ward). Be aware that some rooms do not have in-room shower & toilet; others have tiny shower, but no toilet, and others have it all. No A/C and the fan in my room did not work, so I had to open the window and get some street noise. I think the better (and higher priced rooms) are facing the quiet side street and should not have a problem. Staff was friendly. So if the price is right and you get the desired restroom components, it should be OK as a base for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “a good weekend”
Reviews.Author: marten0
Reviews.Content: we spent in this hotel a really good weekend. The hotel is located in a strategic area to visit Rome by public transport or on foot. the service is really excellent, the staff is very friendly and the night porter a very helpful and very nice. We started very early, and Mr. Virgil has given us a very rich Italian breakfast although the service was still chiuso.quando come back, definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unhesitatingly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Sam_I_Am_Boise
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before choosing this hotel with our travel package from Expedia. I paid $13 extra/night for a standard double (attached bath was very important for us). The final rate included breakfast. The hotel also had free wifi which is the most important amenity these days. Room: I read a lot of reviews of Rome hotel both here on trip advisor and Expedia that got me a bit worried about the size of the room. I knew European hotel rooms would be small but how small? One reviewer said that their Saturnia room was so small they couldn't even properly open their suitcase in the room. That got me into panic mode. I need not have worried so much. The room was adequately sized for two people with two carry on size bags. (Frankly, I have experienced far worse much close to home in San Fran but that's a different review for another day.) Even though there is no elevator, we got a second floor room which was not too difficult to manage with the bags - stair case was standard width. The most challenging thing about the room was the shower stall. Very tight but in the end, manageable. And I would recommend that you consider taking a travel hair dryer although the room does come with one but it is awkward to use and not efficient (see photo and you will understand what I mean). Another small issue was that the bed had two mattresses side by side instead of a queen size mattress, and that meant that I, who tends to drift into the middle of the bed, always ended up on the spine and it did cause minor discomfort. The room had its own AC and even a small fridge. At night the road outside can be noisy. Just street sounds. You can close the windows and turn on the AC and be oblivious to all that. We chose not to - because the fresh breeze felt nice but Rome appears to stay loudly awake all night so this may not work for most people. :) We got used to it. Staff/Service: The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the day we arrived we were allowed to check in at 11 am. And then we were offered a cup of coffee. Very much appreciated after a long overnight flight. All except one desk staff spoke English. And the one who didn't - he tried his best to understand us and be understood. Very amicable. They let me use their computer to get tickets to museums in Florence and print out receipts. (Although I recommend that you do not go this route - make all reservations ahead of time from the US). Bathroom was small but had everything including a bidet. Breakfast was great - saved us both time and money every morning. Not the big greasy American style breakfast though - but lots of choices and healthier. Made to order coffee, various kinds of croissants, jams, nutella, cheese spreads, hard boiled eggs, rolls and yummy cheese slices for a quick sandwich, three kinds of cereal and milk, juice, and yogurt. Location: Best thing about the hotel is its location! Termini is a 5-minute walk. You will discover that this is the best amenity of ALL. BTW< in getting to hotel once you arrive into Termini from the airport (Leonardo express for 14 euro one-way, 30 minutes), do not follow google maps direction to hotel. Instead just find the Piazza del Cinquecento exit and get onto Via Cavour. Walk straigh down Via Cavour and Via Ruiniglia is on right (hotel has a sign visible from Cavour. Area amenities: Lots of eateries in the area (favorite hole in the wall - Forno da Milvio on Via Dei Serpenti - cheap, fast, but yummy food). Also in the neighborhood, one of the most charming places in Monti area - the piazza madonna dei monti. At dusk locals of all ages gather here and just sit and chat. Very cool. You can walk from here to the Colosseum in 10 minutes. There are at least three groceries nearby for water, juice, fruits, etc. As well as a pharmacy within a block. Area seems quited safe. We were out till about midnight every night and we never felt ill at ease. What else does one need?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kateejack11
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. It is centrally located, clean and the staff all very friendly and helpful. It was basic however this was OK given my friends and I were out enjoying Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tangomamma
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Saturnia from May 10th to May 15th with my mother. We were impressed by the kindness and efficiency of the staff and the location of the hotel - only 5 minutes to the Colosseum! Exiting the hotel, when you make a left, there is a nice long street full of restaurants, shops and an Internet Cafe - walking in the neighbohood at night was also very safe. The breakfast was served in the room adjoining the reception and the selection was good - of course, not your typical bacon-and-eggs breakfast, and I challenge anybody to find this type of breakfast in Europe, but a good selection of bread, pastries, cheese and meats. We are already plan ing on returning to Rome next year and we will book ourselves at the Saturnia again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Walk_n_Eat
Reviews.Content: When we travel, we don't spend a lot of time in a hotel, so what we care about is a clean room and bathroom, a comfortable bed and friendly and helpful staff - and a nice breakfast is a bonus. The Hotel Saturnia was perfect for our stay in Rome. The location was terrific - not far from the train station and metro, and within walking distance of almost everything in the historic area. Beds were comfortable, everything was clean, the breakfast array was very nice, and the staff was THE BEST. Tiziano - and Kali - were wonderful, kind and helpful gentlemen! They went out of their way to take care of us, and we will always appreciate that. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but a good value for those who need it.”
Reviews.Author: Paripatetico
Reviews.Content: A five-minute walk from the Termini train station, 10 minutes from the Colosseum, and many other attractions. Very helpful staff fluent in English (during the day); small rooms with good basic amenities, but nothing fancy. Noisy at night; not for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, no lift”
Reviews.Author: Molendinari
Reviews.Content: In general, we were happy with the quiet location just off the main street. The rooms were clean and neat, the beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked. But the lack of a lift and narrow stairway made moving the bags quite difficult, and the rooms were so small there was no space to open a suitcase!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyV919
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Saturnia for 3 nights during our 2 week stay in Rome. We really enjoyed this hotel. Our room was located off the main road which made made it a little noisy but we never found it to be too big of an issue at night. We booked a room with a detached bathroom, which was the first time we've done this and didn't find it weird at all. Our room had a sink and a bidet. The toilet and shower were just across the hall. There may have been another room sharing the bathroom with us but we never ran into them or found it to be an issue at all. The staff was very welcoming and warm. They pointed many things out on the map for us when we arrived. We were a lot closer to the Colosseum than we had thought. We pretty much walked everywhere we went. We did take the metro to the Vatican but walked back so we could see some other things along the way. This might be a little much for some people but we found it perfectly manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and helpful Ricardo”
Reviews.Author: coldcanuck
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the hotel has a lot of things going for it. The staff really can really make a stay enjoyable even in mediocre conditions. I must thank Ricardo especially for his kindness and help throughout our stay. They honestly seem to be trying to do some upgrades to the place but I can tell you honestly that dragging luggage up three flights of stairs is not my idea of fun but the one really bad part of the stay was we had a room where the toilet seat kept falling off its hinges.The furnishings were what I would call Spartan but we did not come to Rome to sit in our room. This was quite uncomfortable for a family with two teenage girls. Ricardo was a great host and recommended restaurants and helped me book reservations at the Vatican museum online. This hotel is almost perfectly located on a quieter side street in the center of Rome. Breakfast was enough to get your day started and the free wifi really was very reliable and simple to access. If you want luxury this is not the place for you...The value of this place is the location and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service and a friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: now555
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of April 2011 and can certainly recommend it. Affordable clean rooms and only a short walk from the terminal station and collosseum. We were greeted on entry to the hotel with a very warm welcome as well as being given a map and a quick run through as to the location of the hotel and places we can reach on foot and of interest. I have stayed in hotels that have more stars but came no were near the personable friendly service and welcome we received. Rooms are simple and clean, continental breakfast was fresh and a great location to explore the wonderful city that is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: noah026
Reviews.Content: a trip truly unique. we arrived at this hotel and we were really good. the staff is efficient and gentle cleaning and very pleasant. the doorman of the night showed us also how to get to the beach and it was very nice. Rome is great and is fun to visit, without much difficulty because the hotel is well connected by public transport, and many things you can also visit with a walk. will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lindasnell1955
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff at reception and breakfast where the woman insisted on making fresh coffee rather than letting me use the machine. Room was quite small but fine for two nights city break and bathroom tiny but again adequate for purpose. Very good value for money and easy to find from the main Termini Station which is where bus from Ciampino airport drops passengers. Walking distance to most main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “the bad weather, beautiful roma”
Reviews.Author: costas28
Reviews.Content: Sin,the weather was not very good, we visited rome in the rain. People are much sun,roma wonder that we have done a lot and we were hikingsensation words. The colosseum and the ancient streets take you have the time to dream so close but so far we have come out very soon from the hotel to go to pompei. The night porter, gave us the alarm and made us a delicious cappuccino, was very kind, given that the time was not suitable for breakfast. In particulargave us good indications pompei for traveling to our hotel has a friendly staff, roomsa bit small but clean Mr. Kali very nice but kind a fiery sicilian

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: drgirlfriend74
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely, friendly, helpful and polite. We were allowed to check in at 12.30 PM ( a rarity anywhere) and we were offered coffees while we waited. The coffee (regular, one espresso) were to die for! They perked up right up. The room was very clean and the lovely housekeeper showed up us. In my broken Italian I made out what she was showing us. The only minor issue is that the bathroom pipes smelled. As I had lived in China, this did not bother me at all. But we realized that if you left the fan running in the bathroom with the door closed, it faded away. The room was small. As was the bathroom. Very small. I am 5'7 and my husband is 6 feet and we found it cramped. But the room was very warm which was good as it was cold and rainy in Rome. We ran the air conditioner at night to remove the stuffiness of the room. Through no fault of the hotel, some guests decided to use the hallways as a meeting place in the middle of the night and were very loud. Fortunately for me, I heard nothing the second night we were there. The benefit to the noisy guests was, I could not hear any traffic noise or street noise. We were on the second floor, facing the back, beside a court yard and although there was noise during the day, it was quiet at night. We paid only £98 for two nights in Rome and for the most important reason why I am rating this hotel well: location. You can walk from the main terminus or jump on the subway and go one stop. You can walk to the Colloseum as well. Variety of restaurants around the hotel, and an amazing gelato / pancake cafe nearby. The area felt safe, the people around the area were all very smartly dressed and generally one got a sense that the properties around the area were expensive. There were some posh little delis close by as well and small bars. Breakfast was continental but delicious. I had some juice (not sure what kind but it was ruby in colour and sweet). The pastries were very good and the coffee, amazing. If you have a budget or don't fancy a hotel further out of the city, I recommend staying here. One or two nights is perfect for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “kindness and cordiality”
Reviews.Author: steflovely
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for three days,we really appreciated the friendliness of the staff. a small hotelsituated in a strategic area for travel, very comfortable. the night porter was a courtesy only, absolutely recommend it. excellent breakfast, clean rooms, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: xxBettyxx
Reviews.Content: This is as stated a 2 star hotel, however we were really happy we chose this hotel for our stay. Location is excellent, close to main termini and most of the main attractions are within walking distance. Rooms were cleaned daily, fresh clean towels were provided daily. The staff did all they could to make our visit to Rome a succesful one and were happy to answer questions or queries about travelling to different destinations etc. We had an early flight and had to leave at 6am, the hotel arranged a taxi and breakfast was provided for us on asking in the morning. We slept well every evening. I would recommend this hotel for it's location, cleanliness and helpfulness of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: Clau_y_Mati
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. It was cose to Termin central station so the bus, the subway and the train were nearby. Breakfast was good with variety of things to choose. If you want to have breakfast early, the girl wasn't there to make you an expresso. So, you have to make it yourself with the automatic machine. When we arrived, they offered us a room with shower. The shower was inside the room, without privacy. While you were laying on the bed, you could see your partner taking a shower... And the bidet also was inside the room, between the shower and the closet. That was a strange thing, but nothing to worry about. The street was very noisy, but if you let the window closed you could sleep like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, but great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Trodnog
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend were in Rome for 4 days in january. We chose this hotel out of the more budget friendly options that were available through a package deal. It's located not far from Termini (the central station), and only a few steps away from Santa Maria Maggiore. More or less walking distance to everything in central Rome. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice and clean, albeit it didn't have it's own toilet (only shower and sink), and the double bed was actually two single beds put together. These were only minor concerns however. Breakfast was simple but nice. The breakfast room was tiny, but since we stayed during low season it didn't get awfully cramped. The main attraction of this hotel is it's great location, and the friendly staff makes it very easy to overlook it's flaws. Recomendable for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandy6320
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20-year old daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks. Extremely kind and professional staff. Breakfast was great with buffet style offerings of cold meat/cheese tray, hard rolls, pastries, coffee/hot chocolate, 3 kinds of cereal, and hard-boiled eggs. You could have as much as you wanted. Recommended several local good restaurants. Rooms and bathrooms are small but adequate, very clean. Would definitely recommend for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Simply and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: jimtmimt
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on internet and i choose it for location and price. Staff ver helpful at arrival and for all the stay. Free internet connection well working too. very good breakfast every morning. Romm cleaning every day. And location is perfect. I recommend this hotel always.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem. Lovely little hotel, clean and welcoming in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AndiePe
Reviews.Content: When the cab driver dropped us off he said we'd chosen a great hotel and he wasn't wrong. 5 minutes walk to the train station and only ten minutes from the Colosseum Nice bars and restaurants just a stones throw away. The staff were all really warm and friendly and gave us a map on arrival and lots of good advice. Breakfast was all you could eat - cereals, breads, pastries, cheese, meats etc and great coffee obviously. The hotel was spotless and really nicely decorated. Our room was small but had everything we needed, again, it was clean, warm and nicely decorated. Don't expect a view because of where the hotel is situated - on a side street surrounded by buildings but we only went back to the hotel to sleep. I would definitely recommend the Saturnia and can't wait to return. You won't need a wake up call, the bells of Santa Maria Maggiore will do that at 7am which just added to my wonderful Rome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best it can get”
Reviews.Author: antonella1985
Reviews.Content: Excellent service at this hotel, delicious breakfast, big choice of food, very helpful staff. I expected much worse room, but it turned out really fine. You can judge by my photo! Hotel is in a great location maybe 5 minutes walking from Colosseo and Vittorio Emanuelle. I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't expect much from a 2* hotel and I was still disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hayden43
Reviews.Content: I didnt expect much from a 2* hotel, just a clean comfortable room and friendly service, but I was disappointed. Negatives -Room was in the middle of being renovated. There was plaster on the walls and part of the door frame was missing (however the room was clean) -For 2 days, they continued renovations in the hallway outside our room during the day (banging on walls etc). At one point, a guy knocked on our door and came into our room to inspect what needed to be renovated. -Bed was extremely uncomfortable and I could feel all the springs. They also made the bed with a top sheet and something resembling a table cloth. A blanket was in the cupboard which we used, but it looked unclean. -Room had a shower and bidet, but no toilet. The room didnt have a bathroom - the shower was literally at the end of the bed and all a part of the same room - weird. -The hotel staff had limited english and didnt have much knowledge of the local area. -It was advertised that there was free wifi, however we were told only 1 hour per day was free and after that is was about 5 Euro for a few hours. Also, the wifi on our floor didnt work and we had to go into the lobby to use it. At one point the cleaner was mopping the floor in the lobby and she made me get up from my table and wait while she mopped underneath. -There was free breakfast which included stale bread and croissants. Later in the day I saw the croissants on a plate uncovered which explained why they were stale. Positives -They let us have a late check out (at 6pm) -Towels were big I would NOT recommend this hotel. The location was ok, but in hindsight I would stay closer to the river in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful & nice staff, centrally located, aromatic coffee and tasty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SexysuzyWong
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The location is very good: minutes walk from the train station, walking distance to major attractions and subway. The front desk staff and maids were all very professional and helpful. They allowed me to use their front desk computer to book the Coliseum and had the booking printed out.
