I had a very good impression of Rome mainly because of this hotel, as it was my 1st destination of my one month long honeymoon. Very good coffee and good breakfast buffet. (I was later really disappointed in this trip when I was in Venice, regretted spending 3 nights there and spending almost 10 thousand dollars for this whole Europe honeymoon trip to find out that I was the last one to know that Italian men are well known for being disrespectful to women.So, my comments was Venice was nice, but the men......) Beware when you go to a restaurant, try to stay away from restaurants with staff waving for your business, stay away from English menu, and know to check itemized bill on your receipt and count your change when you purchase anything. I had plenty of experience shop keepers gave me a wrong receipt with items I did not purchase and bill me more, intentionally gave me less change back. Some shops they intentionally "forgot" to put items I purchased when I bought a lot of things. Some restaurants asked for a 25% tip. Only disadvantage of this hotel: No elevator, no fridge inside the room, bathroom was small. I requested a quiet room so I was assigned a room at the top floor which was the only room at that floor. At night there were smokes came in. Since I was at the top floor it was relatively quiet. The good staff and good coffee are the best of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with amazing service and location...great value!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler9879
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnia was a wonderful place to stay in Rome for an ideal price. The rooms were simple and clean, everything you needed and clean sheets and towels each day. The front desk was extremely welcoming and accommodating with directions and helpful advice. Location was an easy 10 minute walk from Termini Station and within walking distance of major destinations (Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon.) We felt safe in the location and the security was good. Breakfast was perfect and included cereal, breads, meat, hard-boiled eggs and of course cappuccino. No complaints at all and would recommend to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, great service BUT....”
Reviews.Author: lupilove04
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in September in this hotel. One of my first surprises was reservations via internet. Although their booking engine states that they will NOT actually charge your credit card and will only do so when you arrive, this was completely false. They charged me one night's stay in July (as soon as I made the online reservations, although we arrived in late September). I wrote them right away, worried about my credit card limit since I was out of the country at the time and did not want to have unexpected charges...they assured that the charge was "reversible" but that was false also, and to prove it, I took my bank statement with me, showing the one night they charged plus the foreign currency fee. Once we got over that initial bad impression, we were greeted late at night upon arrival, only to learn there were no elevators and we were in a unit in the fourth floor. Stairs are wide enough up to the third floor...but later, from the 3rd to the 4th floor, the stairs are challenging for anyone...spiral, narrow metal stairs. The rooms are very basic...barely any decoration and just o.k. Beds are simple and mattresses were a bit hard. Our A/C did not work and although a gentleman from the front desk came to check on it, it never did work. We were changed to the "family room" the next day, which was nice because it is on the ground level and more ample, but even more "basic".,nevertheless the bathroom was nice and clean and beds had mattresses just as stiff as the firs unit. A/C did not work here either. In summary, here goes my personal pros/cons list: PROS: - Excellent location, very close to public transportation and a walking distance to some attractions - VERY basic rooms which are clean - Santa Maria Maggiore church is half a block away, with a tourist center across the street and it is also a stop for all double decker tour buses, which are an excellent value in Rome - Free wi-fi - Great dining options nearby - Wonderful breakfast, with hot and cold selections although room is tiny - Staff is very friendly CONS: - They will probably charge you for one night when booking online, regardless of their reservation/cancellation policy!! - Avoid 4th floor if you have mobility issues - Avoid rooms facing the main street...there are a few restaurants with live music that can be noisy - Make sure your A/C is working and cooling as soon as you check in your room, if you travel in a warm season - Mattresses are uncomfortable Although in the end I was glad to have stayed in Hotel Saturnia, I will stay elsewhere in Rome next time I visit. I would only recommend it for those that want a BASIC room close to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: BarryZ27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in late October. Booked pretty much blind, apart from browsing the reviews here on Tripadvisor. A very reasonable price, and a very handy location, about 5 minutes walk from the central Termini train/bus/metro station. Another 5/10 minutes walk to the Colesseum, and within 30 minutes to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, etc... Very friendly and helpful staff, a most acceptable breakfast provided ( no cooked food, but cereals, croissants, fruit, yoghurts, tea/coffee). The room was small (but certainly not so much so to be a problem), clean, and perfectly suitable - As said elsewhere, you don't really go to Rome to spend the day in a hotel room anyway, no matter how wonderful that may be... In conclusion, I hope to return to Rome someday, and I know for sure I won't be looking any further than here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a carefree journey”
Reviews.Author: australiageelong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two days and although our room was a bit small, were very hospitable. The bed was very comfortable and clean, the bathroom always with hot water, and there was always a good smell. The breakfast well stocked with various foods, and gustosi.Il friendly staff, and Mr. Virgilio was very kind to give us good information on where to eat and how to take public transportation. The room was not very expensive but excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, and great location”
Reviews.Author: beccagrumpus
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Saturnia. The room and bathroom were very small, but clean, and the staff were very helpful with travel tips. I do wonder if we paid too much, but at the same time, it was a last minute stay and we do not regret staying at the Saturnia. We especially liked the location, close to the Termini station and the Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “basic rooms but really good location”
Reviews.Author: robdavid1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saturnia for 4 nights while visting Rome. Rome will keep you so busy that you wont even realize you have returned to your small basic room . Its a budget hotel in a very good location (a really short walk to the colleseum and the train station )and doesnt try to be anything else. For us, Rome wasnt about the hotel and more about the sites. The bathrooms are tight but everything worked and was clean. The bed was a little uncomfortable but acceptable. The staff were very friendly and helpful - calling to make reservations or giving direction. side note 1 : the borghese museum requires a reservation a few days in advance but you can get cancelations at the door - we fell into that category - but well worth it. side note 2 : eat in trastervere - across the bridge- its way easier to find a table and cheaper. side note 3: there is a guided tour outside the colleseum for 8 euros that includes the pallatine and the forum. Im not a big tour group guy but it was worth it as the pallatines not clearly signed (in fact there are none) and jason our pallatine guide was excellent. So stay at the Saturnia if you dont mind basic and cheap. I thought the breakfast was good. I didnt look to see if the food was left out over night - but i dont look at kitchens in restaurants either - its easier that way. oh and ask for a coffee to be made at the bar its better than the machine. Rome can be expensive so why pay for a hotel that youre hardly be in. oh and the Roma pass turned out to be a good deal - using the subway many times .. have fun. Rob

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Huitui67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. People very helpful and clean room. Breakfast in the morning was nice. Location is the best. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: pillorobu85
Reviews.Content: The service was the best i've found in Europe. We travel all Europe in five and four stars hotel but we've never found this service. People smiling every day. Receptionists helps you for everything....restaurant, monuments, advise and all you need. This is important for me. The rest was also nice, two more stars than they have. Thanks to Virgilio and Ticiano.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Kick”
Reviews.Author: Guy_Rotem
Reviews.Content: Walking from Termini station to Saturnia I could understand why people wrote that "it's not the best neighborhood in Rome, but still it's impossible to expect the entire place to look like one big tourist attraction. Snug comfortably in a tiny no-car street makes Saturnia a quiet hotel and a decent option for those who don't require much from their mattress but do need a quiet sleeping environment. I don't recall the amount of rooms in this small hotel, but my only suggestion would be to make sure you do NOT get a corner room. All of the rooms are small , that's acceptable, but the corner room we got was so small that once both our medium suitcases were on the floor we barely had a square meter to stand on. A double bed, a small closet, decent AC and a tiny but clean bath made this room a place to keep our luggage and go to sleep. Staying awake in it is not for the claustrophobic visitors. Wide-shouldered people will find the shower a bit problematic, but having as much hot water as I wanted was a good thing to have. Once that's over and done with I can say that outside the (corner) room the place was nothing but great. The people were nice, the breakfast was satisfactory and all our questions and requests were answered fast and with a smile. The staff in Saturnia are well aware of their weaknesses and work hard to even the odds with a good and thorough service. If your hotel room is meant for a luggage keeping and sleeping at night - Saturnia is a good selection and great value for money. If you require more from your room, make sure you don't get a corner room or book someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2nights in September 2010 Pros Good Location close to Rome Terminal Railway station 10-15min walk. Close to the Colosseum 15min walk. 15-20min walk to Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. All sites are in reasonable proximity. Bus system a little hard to decipher – so walked most of the journey. Metro at Rome Terminal can get you to the Vatican City easily. Friendly staff all with good english Cold simple breakfast – average enough to get you started for the day. Fridge in room Cons Room very small – may be the Rome standard? No lift Booking indicated free wifi in public areas. When I arrived internet the rate was 5Euro/3hours – however they did offer me 1hour free pass (it was accessible in room). Airconditioning unreliable – keeps switching off every so often. Overall a simple no frills place which does the job in a good location. However, for the price around 150AUD per night (although i have heard Rome is very expensive accommodation wise) I kind of expected a little more. Nothing majorly wrong with the hotel, just very small rooms and the fact that they changed their policy on internet usage without informing the client.

Reviews.Title: “A plate to love”
Reviews.Author: kikko4
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. I loved it. All people quiet and smiling all days from the front desk to the ladies of room cleaning. Thanks to Riccardo, Kali and Virgilio and thanks to Michela and Palmira. Rooms are ok clean every day. Breakfast excellent and fresh every morning. I will came back to Rome to stay in Hotel Saturnia. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Discrete hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jator-C
Reviews.Content: After staying in the hotel one full week, the service can be considered excellent, taking into account that the majority of time I was visiting the city. Some thing needs improvement, but respecting to the personnel responsible, excellent in attendance, in helping and in chatting. The breakfast is correct, taking into account that we are talking about a 2-star hotel. Bed comfort and DBT are part of the room. Special attention from Riccardo was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Room clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: tyrygi48
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in internet and after reading all rewiews i decided to book a two star hotel for my first time. So was excellent. Some times little hotel are really better than a big one. Room was cleaned every day, breakfast rich and fresh all mornings and staff really friendly and helpful. I will recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in every sense”
Reviews.Author: elliot72
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 nights in Sept 2010. When we looked at hotels in Rome we came to the conclusion that we should expect the worst and we were still disappointed. The room had the minimum of the cheapest furniture. We paid for private facilities and got a shower, sink and bidet! - no toilet. There was no bathroom in the room they were just fitted in the corner of the room. The toilet was private between everyone on the second floor! Some people did not have a shower in the room so were using the bathroom with the only toilet making it even worse. We had a block of wood with a light bulb sticking out of the top for a bed side light. The noise of the fan kept us awake at night but was slightly better than the noise from the open window. The dining room was half the size of my dining room at home and had just 4 tables which were crammed in so you had to queue. The only good point was that it was clean, not too far from the sights and the staff were helpful. This hotel is stuck in the 1950s and is desperate for an upgrade.Try and find somewhere better or perhaps if not dont go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: little_wing123
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to be slap bang in the middle of town. A short walk from Termini, the Colosseum and the Palatine, as well as a few Metro stops, it's a great location. It's down a tiny side street that's not on many maps, so make sure you Google Map it before you leave, or get a taxi. We couldn't find it when we arrived, but once we got there by taxi and knew where it was, we had no trouble. There's no lift, so be prepared to carry your bags up a few flights of steps. The double room we stayed in was very small, but neat, clean and all we wanted for our stay. Not really a place for romance, but perfect for sightseeing. The staff were lovely (the concierge looked exactly like Antonio Banderas!), the continental breakfast was very nice and there are plenty of snack bars, cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area, if you get peckish. In short, a lovely little hotel for a short stay in bella Roma :)

Reviews.Title: “You can find better in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Had a double room on second floor facing a very noisy street. No A/C, a must in Rome in summer. The room was supposed to be en suite, but had only a shower and sink. The shower was in the middle of the room. Very awkward. The toilet was down the hall... Was often occupied in the mornings as guests from rooms with no shower were using the shower. The staff was very friendly, the location central and the breakfast basic. With so many choices in Rome, there is surely better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decent rooms, overall experience was great.”
Reviews.Author: Gipsytravler
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and very friendly. The room was small, kept up, with a little bit of mildew in the bathroom. Every morning we had a complimentary breakfast with choices of cereal, milk, yogurt, danishes, toasts with jams, along with coffee, teas, and other drinks that were often offered. I will stay there again when I should visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: edmonton32
Reviews.Content: I was a guest in this hotel two days and I was fine. Breakfast excellent, staff polite and friendly, clean room. a salute to Mr. Virgilio, really nice

Reviews.Title: “appreciable”
Reviews.Author: panda031
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Mr. Virgil have found accommodation in this fantastic hotel. We arrived at the station terms without reservation and without knowing the city. He gave us a comfortable and maps, without which we would have lost in this great city. All very nice and helpful, all wonderful, very fast internet to communicate with friends and family. We had great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lopacchius
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Saturnia. It is a quaint, comfortable hotel with a price that can't be beat. Even better, it is in close walking distance to all major attractions in the city of Rome. There are numerous shops and restaurants close to the hotel, and you can find several authentic restaurants and experiences that aren't too touristic. I agree with the writer about everything. The Hotel Saturnia is a family run hotel with some of the best service I have had anywhere. The staff are friendly and always happy to do what they can to help.There is a laundromat and small supermarket very close by, and an autobank and post box across the street. The free wi-fi in my room was very welcome and the speed was fine for research and writing emails. Nice breakfast too. I would stay there again without hesitation. We were there for eight days and were sad to leave... it was like leaving family!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the train station. Kali at the front desk is very helpful and friendly. The room was good--the AC worked, the bed was comfortable, and everything in the bathroom worked, although the bathroom was tiny. Breakfast was fine. Overall, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saturnia's staff are most helpful”
Reviews.Author: MTC212
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome, Italy for 10 days. My husband, myself and our two grown children. We stayed on the first floor, which was nice due to there only being stairs to the 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors. Our room was quiet, had a small refrigerator and was convenient and comfortable. Our two boys stayed on the 4th floor which was fine for them. They had a small balcony that they could walk out on that overlooked a small pub and a few shops below. The continental breakfast as good, although you get tired of eating the same thing day after day. Breakfast consisted of bread, pastries, cheese, ham, cereals, hot cocoa, coffee, orange juice and hard boiled eggs. The location is very convenient. Only a 10 minute walk to the main Termini subway/bus station which makes getting all over Rome very easy. However, the most impressive part about the hotel is the staff. They speak English very well and know the city inside and out. They can direct you to any place you want to go. I strongly recommend this hotel due to it's location but mostly because of the staff. I would not recommend traveling to Italy during the summer months. It is very hot and humid and most places do not have air conditioning. The hotel has air although it is not what we are used to in the U.S. Other than the heat, Rome is an awesome trip to see historical sites and experience a different culture and great food. Hotel Saturnia will make you feel like you are a VIP traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Colosseum, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: colin_read
Reviews.Content: The Saturnia is close to the Colosseum, with restaurants and bars nearby. It can be noisy (not necessarily their fault, as one day a truck decided to unload its contents at 6:00 in the morning outside the windows). The rooms are small, but they have a fridge - however it was not working in either room, and neither was repaired throughout our 3-day stay. Overall, it was an average experience, and my single room was good value for somewhere simple.

Reviews.Title: “No a/c in July”
Reviews.Author: cosmo-the-dog
Reviews.Content: Staff brought us a fan and said they don't like a/c anyway. They gotta be kidding!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel: clean, very friendly&helpful staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Michele0046
Reviews.Content: Normally, I never write reviews of hotels, but for this one, I want to take the effort to do so, because the people who run this hotel really deserve good reviews like this one. First of all, the hotel is located at only 10 to 15 minutes walking from Termini station, so you don't have to take the metro to get there. It is located in a sidestreet of Via Cavour, but we weren't bothered by noises at all. Our room wasn't very big, but it was comfortable and perfectly cleaned. Outside, it was 33 degrees, but we had airco in the room. The shower worked very well and there is also a tv. The staff was VERY friendly! It is a team of enthusiastic people who seem to come along very well. They gave us great advise about Rome (e.g. where to go, where to eat, where to hang out, ...). They were always in for a small chat and some jokes. We really liked them. So a special thanks to Kali, Diogo, Riccardo, Virgilio, Palmira, Lilly and Michela! The breakfast was perfect. Not a huge amount of things to chose from, but there were a lot of croissants, toast, boiled eggs, cornflakes, coffee, tea, orange juice, milk, ham, confiture, butter, nutella, .... Anything you need! Thank you very much for your service! You were great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: JenP1980
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a few hours before check-in time. Titiano (I'm sorry if I've spelled it wrong), greeted us with a smile, offered to hold our bags, let us use the restroom , and offered us coffee and tea right away. He also got out a map to give us, circled the main attractions he thought would be worth seeing, and even made some dining recommendations. This was our first stop in our first trip to Europe, and we couldn't have felt more welcome. Titiano was fabulous! The hotel is a short walk (about 10 minutes) from Termini Station, and it's also a great location for site seeing. We walked from the hotel to every site we wanted to see in Rome, even Vatican City (though this was quite a long walk, about half an hour). Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was quite friendly and spoke good english. The breakfast was nice, breads, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, etc. The room had a ceiling fan, which was a blessing. The room had a shower and bidet, the toiled was shared. bathroom was kept quite clean. I highly recommend this hotel, we had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: ry0_Saeba
Reviews.Content: + Ideally located, next to the train station clean rooms nice breakfast - Small rooms Expensive for the provided service

Reviews.Title: “holiday in rome”
Reviews.Author: john22amsterdamm
Reviews.Content: small and beautyful hotel in rome downtown, close to colosseum and few minuts from termini station, but at the same time in a silent little road (this is really special in rome...)people of the hotel very friendly. good price, nice breakfast.we suggest this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: marine1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is famous for the staff and for people working there....and is true. We received a nice welcome at arrival and for all the stay they are so friendly. Very good breakfast and nice comfortable room. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: advaitin
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome in May 2009 for a two week stay, arriving at the Termini, since we prefer train travel whenever possible. Because of bags, we took a taxi--although it really is only a ten minute walk down Via Cavour to the hotel. Walking or in a taxi, the problem is spotting the side street that the hotel is on. I include a view from Via Cavour to help. Via Ruinaglia was in the process of being permanently blocked to vehicles turning in from Via Cavour, so the taxis either have to stop on Cavour or go down the parallel Via Urbana. It's not as complicated as it sounds. The street being blocked makes for a quieter night's sleep. Do not expect to sleep late however, as a school and a service entrance is directly across the alley and they start making noise fairly early. This would only affect party-types, not families and tourists interested in seeing the sights and getting an early start. Ricardo was very helpful from making Email reservations and throughout our stay as was Virgilio. The fact that there is no elevator made for good exercise getting to the breakfast each morning. The food was more than adequate, although it typifies the "Continental" style. Most Americans would have no problem satisfying their morning appetite. Coffee could be either self serve or made by the staff and I seemed to be offered coffee day or night as I often used the desk in front of reception or the breakfast room for editing my pictures and blog (better WiFi reception). Speaking of that, if the hotel's WiFi was down, there was good reception to a public network exactly at the corner by the restaurant on Via Cavour. The hotel is old--sort of like Rome is old. But the amenities are fairly new and work--the plumbing and electricity, that is. The staff are extremely helpful. My only untoward event was the loss of my primary set of eyeglasses. I attribute that to no one but myself, as I am careless about where I set things down--and remembering to pick them up. In this case I am certain that the stylish but small prescription glasses with non-glare lenses and thin black wire frame were swept into the trash but by the time I realized they were gone, so was the trash. Fortunately, I am a belt and suspenders guy, so I had a backup pair of glasses in my suitcase. As another reviewer said, many of the places to eat along Via Cavour cater to tourists and are expensive for what you get. Because of our long stay, we were treated to a meal at the restaurant next door. We ate there a few times and we learned that a small deceit was employed to increase the bill. If the charming waiter says, "would you like to sample this?" or "try a taste of ... while you wait for your meal." He does not mean that it is really a sample or just a taste, it will be a charge on your meal. On the other hand watching the waiters flirt with every passing woman and even more with those at the tables was well worth the price of admission. Because I did not see this behavior regularly at other places we ate, I suspect it was mostly for show--but who knows. We found our least expensive meals by going into the neighborhood behind Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, where there were ethnic (and authentic) places, plus a few restaurants offering Italian regional specialties. We also ate at Turkish-run pizza stands on side streets and snacked at interesting wine bars. My opinions and findings are posted at http://www.travelblog.org/Bloggers/Advaitin/ if you are interested in more pictures and ramblings about Rome. Suffice to say that you can shop around and find reasonable prices both in the neighborhood of the hotel and in Rome. Much is within walking distance of the hotel, including the subway, which we rode once, and the bus system, which we used constantly, usually going to and from the bus station in front of the Termini. I would be remiss if I did not mention the gelato stand just a block down Via Cavour on the right. Perfecto! Also the Gelato place on the right side of the Pantheon as you face the entrance. That one is in the travel guides.

Reviews.Title: “Vert helpful staff, great breakfast, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug3411
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in March. The first nights of our first ever visit to Europe! What a great first impression of Rome and of Italy! This hotel is very easy to get to from Tremini and affords easy access to the subway and buses to get around the city. On our last day we rented our car at Tremini and were heading up to Tuscany. Ricardo (I think that is his name!) was so very helpful with detailed directions to get us through the Roman streets to the Autostrada. We only got lost once (our bad!) and found driving in Rome to be kind of fun! Room was large and clean, bathroom smallish but functional and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “" REALLY STUPENDOUS"”
Reviews.Author: hannett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really stupendous. My companion and I had never been in a place of the kind. And' extraordinary, different from the other hotels where we have sojourned in past. Furnished with good taste and clean, personal kind, abundant and mixed breakfast, all perfect. The signor Virgilio is really a good person, hospitable and ready to any application. We will also send our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: obliocu
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Saturnia and to be honest we can't complain for nothing. The quality of service is very good and the personal is helpful (thank you guys for everything!). Also the breakfast is very good. We must say that they have a nice arrangement in the hotel, lots of nice paintings, beautiful decorations. The rooms are offering all the comfort that you need in a trip but this it's a matter of taste. We liked it! The hotel's location is nice - very close to Termini or Cavour metro station, Colosseum or other objectives. Grazie a lei signori!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff in Rome, maybe Italy!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TangyEvents
Reviews.Content: Overall a great experience at this hotel, 5 min to 10 min walk to everything. Coliseum, trevi fountain, termini train station, etc... is only a 5 to 10 min walk. Free WiFi, Breakfast, juice and coffee are available in the lobby 24 hrs. Good restaurants and bars within walking distance(stay away from L'angolo Di Napoli, the service was awful and the food was worse. Stop by Druid's Walk bar, you will find a Guiness sign outside, a block away from the hotel. Tell Fargus that Richard Tang sent you.) The hotel is a more boutique style hotel but the staff is amazing! Kaly, Ricardo and Tiziano are probably the best staff in Rome, actually I believe they are the best! For a 2 star hotel, the staff are 5 star caliber. EXAMPLES: 1. The flights of steps weren't exciting but the staff were will to run anything up to you. 2. My girlfriend and I woke up a little late for breakfast(2 hours late lol...) and Tiziano opened breakfast back up, as my gf said she was a little hungry to me. 3. I got stuck in Rome because of VOLCANO, and not only did they not gouge me but they actually gave me a better rate then when I original booked on expedia. Before I left I told Kaly I might be back because of the ash clouds Kaly responded "just come back and I will find you a room and if I can't Ricado can find a room somewhere else it is easier for us to make deals for you guys." Ricardo's response to the situation was "in situations of crisis we shouldn't gouge people we should help them." We came back after getting gouged at THE AIRPORT PALACE HOTEL/THE SATELITE PALACE HOTEL and they welcomed us with open arms. Ricardo found us a room at the Residenza Ki Hotel(a sister Hotel), where I found Diego waiting for me downstairs to welcome me to the hotel and grab our bags. Glad to be back home but these guys are amazing, and if you do decide to check into this hotel tell the staff Richard Tang says hello and Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: marcellenew
Reviews.Content: The Saturnia is found next to the station termini, from which can be gone for all Roma. And a small hotel, very acrative where gentless is of hause. The connection internet is fast, the breakfast is very good and the really clean room. The Mister Virgilio to the recepsion is an extraodinary person. To whatever time it is always available and kind and you has given us some good information on every thing that served us. This hotel is excellent to sojourn us.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: paulinesse
Reviews.Content: We have sojourned to the Saturnia after pasqua and we have been really well. The breakfast includes a variety of food that satisfies. The S. Virgilio, very cordial and kind person, has furnished us information to visit the most beautiful places of roma. The evening always offered us juice of orange before we withdrew there in our room. We are found very well there and we will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: krilndl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very nice stay with good breakfast and nice staff with pleasant service. Situated in a side street this hotel provided quite peaceful nights. Good firm bed! Rooms are small as in most Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ezekielette
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our Honeymoon. We turned up early so they let us leave our stuff there, and were very friendly; they gave us a map and showed us all the attractions and told us about a market that was on that day, so we went and explored. When we got back they said we would be one room for one night and then change our rooms for some reason; we had a choice between two rooms. One next to the hotel through an iron gate (it smelt like sewrage) or one at the top of the hotel up a spiral staircase (smelt better) so we chose that one. The rooms were suitable but if you looked closely it was a bit run down. The toilet in our first room didn't work too well (made me afraid to use it) and the shower was a bit mouldy. Our first room had a double bed plus two single beds, a TV and a mini fridge. They moved our stuff in to our second room the next day so we could explore. The room was quite small, it had a desk and chair, TV and clean bathroom. The rooms were serviced daily. However our bed was on a base with two single matresses pushed together which was incredibly uncomfortable (being on our honeymoon!). We complained to the staff, but they were so nice about it and we couldn't be bothered to change rooms that it really wasn't a big deal. I wasn't a fan of the breakfast, but my husband loved it. It was all sweet breads and cheeses, cereal, tea and coffee and juice. I don't like sweet goods for breakfast, but it would be good if you did. The location was absolutely wonderful. Heaps of shops and restaurants around, and a 10 minute walk from the Colloseum. The Hop on Hop Off bus stops right by the hotel as well. When we left the staff gave us a bottle of olive oil which was lovely, they were incredibly friendly and nice. I'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes you feel like family!”
Reviews.Author: Mom-bird58
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on previous reviews and were very happy with it. Super clean with a decent continental breakfast: boiled eggs, ham slices, croissants & rolls. Like most hotels in Europe, rooms and bathrooms are small - you can book a room with a shared bath or a private bath - we went with a private bath. Plenty of hot water, soap, shower caps and towels. No washcloths. Small flat-screen tv's with satellite. The staff is what makes this place extra special. No surly service here; everyone is so nice and willing to help. I was a woman traveling alone with a 13-year-old daughter; we spoke no Italian and it was our first visit to Rome. The staff speak very good English and were super helpful with info about getting around Rome and to Pompeii and Ostia Antica. Free in-room internet is nice; ask at the desk for the access code. About a 15 minute walk to Termini (the main rail station) and to the Cavour Street stop on the Metro (subway). Also, those huge double-decker hop-on/hop-off tour busses have a stop just about a block away, next to Santa Maria Maggiore - very convenient if you want to take a tour of the city and you can purchase a tour bus ticket at the hotel's front desk. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to the colisseum from the hotel. There's a tobacco shop nearby on Cavour where you can purchase bus/metro tickets. The hotel is actually located on a narrow slip of a sidestreet, just off of busy Cavour Street. The street is blocked off from traffic. The hotel faces the wall of what appears to be a small convent. The hotel itself is quiet, but the church bells peal loudly every morning at 7:00 a.m. You can also hear the garbage trucks come rumbling along Cavour St. in the middle of the night, especially if you have your windows open, but they're gone soon enough and I think this is the case for many hotels. The first night, we stayed in a room on the top floor, which was kind of neat because there are only two rooms on this floor - one was our hotel room and I'm not sure about the other - the door is simply marked 'Private' and has no room number. This top floor room has its own small balcony that looks over the walls of the convent and across some rooftops, which is a pleasant place to sit. This room also has a large king-size bed and a very small bathroom with what has to be the world's tiniest shower. But this room is on the 5th floor (they call it the 4th floor, but it's actually the fifth) and there is no elevator, so it is NOT for people with lots of heavy luggage or who have difficulty climbing long and steep flights of stairs. Definitely a cozy and private little nook, though, so ask for the 4th floor room if that's what you're looking for. Apparently it was booked for someone else the next night, so we were moved to the second floor, and that was good, too. No balcony, but the room was large enough and the shower was a bit larger, which was nice. This place is small, cozy, intimate and very clean. The staff takes a lot of pride in their service to guests and in the overall quality of this hotel. There's a great little restaurant just down the street - about a 15 minute walk in the direction of the colisseum, across from the Metro stop. You can dine outside on the sidewalk or inside. Intimate and cozy, very clean, beautiful and great service. The staff is super pleasant and we thought the Fetuccini Alfredo was great. They also have pizza and many pasta dishes and the menu is in Italian & English. We dined there twice and both times were the only Americans - everyone else appeared to be Italian, so this isn't your typical tourist trap. The name of this little gem is L' Archetto at 195 Cavour St.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, excellent service with warm and welcoming staff, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: plastics101
Reviews.Content: I was at the end of three months of travels when I stayed here, and was able to go home truly relaxed and well rested.

Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL VACATION”
Reviews.Author: vivienne061
Reviews.Content: We have arrived in the hotel with beautiful day of sun and he has alredy been a good sing. Our room was dean clean and wel furnished. The evening the signor Virgilio has recommended us a good place where have eaten very well. He has also prepared us a map with which to visit Roma. We are found really well there.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: tangone1
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good. Location is perfect for visit the old city and the best monument area. Rooms confortable and clean every day. At least staff is really welcoming. They find all information for you and are helpful to all questions. Breakfast in the average. Recommendable

Reviews.Title: “"Saturnia: very pleasant hotel"”
Reviews.Author: solinas
Reviews.Content: I they have been in this hotelwith my companion for three days and we are found very well there. Mister Virgilio, to the reception, she has been kind with us and she has helped us with our baggages, the evening it welcomed us with a good warm coffee, and she has given us useful information to visit this magnificent city. We will surely return because in this hotel we have found really a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Virgilio!”
Reviews.Author: mikel6430
Reviews.Content: This place has great potential and great intentions. Unfortunately these things alone, won't make for a good stay. I was here for 2 nights earlier this month, and the second night was hell!! First thing in the morning when i was getting ready to leave to go check out some sights, i turned my key in to the reception. I was informed that my reservation for the second night, which was made 3 weeks prior to me arriving, had to be juggled a little cause of "system errors". They would have to move me to a smaller room, but at the same rate?? i didn't want to deal with it, as to not waste any time, so i figured "as long as i have a place to sleep". When i returned, a little bit after noon, sure enough my things had been moved to a much much smaller room (rm 104), but i was content to have a place to rest in. I relaxed for a bit and got ready to head out again. I turned my key into reception once again, and when i returned at about 10pm, i asked for my key (rm 104). I was informed that room was occupied by someone else!!! Where are my things?! i asked. They had to scrammble until they figured out where they were. By the time everything was resolved, it was almost midnight!! Fortunately, Virgilio, the man at the front desk, was extremely helpful. He refunded me for the second night stay and paid my cab to the airport the next morning. Aside from the confusion, this place is in a great location and has great rooms. Stay away from Tiziano, a hotel employee, total jerk who shouldn't be working in customer service!! You just don't raise your voice at clients!!!

Reviews.Title: “"under the rain"”
Reviews.Author: patterson090
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel for a couple of days and found wery well there. Our room was furnished with simplicity and good taste.The bat not too much great but clean. The very kind and cordial personnel the breakfast was abundant, and they also served us when we were late whit the schedule. Roma is a really enchanting city to visit, also under the rain.This hotel is well connected a lot ,and whit the help of the signor Virgilio there are not lost a monument. You has know how to give us precise indications on as to move us to visit the whole city. This hotel is a small rare pearl and theavailability of the personnel and the Signor Virgilio they do in way to feel you to haus

Reviews.Title: “Good comfort.”
Reviews.Author: strudele-leon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near Termini station, you can reach it in 10 minutes walking from there. Rooms not so big, anyway is a two star hotel not four! Breakfast in the morning with sweet and salted, very good. Excellent wi-fi, important for me.

Reviews.Title: “Everything came with a big smile.”
Reviews.Author: mattdwilson
Reviews.Content: From being picked up from the airport to going back to the airport you were looked after all the way through. Everyone working in the hotel had a smile and couldnt do enough to make sure you enjoyed your stay. The hotel is close to the Colosseum and the central train station and metro, but rome has most sight seeing place within walking distance. There are alot of resturants and shops just round the corner. The rooms are comfortable with the managers own painting decorating the hallways, rooms, breakfast bar and entrance hall. This hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to stay in Rome and sightsee with family or partners or on your own, and if you need anything just ask. You will be made to feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Small in size, HUGE in hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Big_Jelly_Belly_Baby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Feb. 2010. Hotel is a 5-minute walk from Termini (the main public transport hub of Rome) and very easy to find, tucked away on a quiet side street off Via Cavour. The room we stayed in was tiny but clean. Breakfast was terrific and filling. Consisted of ham, croissants, rolls, boiled eggs, assorted pastries, juices and an awesome cappuccino made with love by the super nice signora behind the bar. The entire staff definitely made you feel very welcome and were very accommodating. They always had a smile on their face. Ricardo even went up to our room to personally show us how to work the safe! Kali was especially memorable as he always took the time to chat with us after our long days and helped point us to some great food places and the best routes to take when walking to the sites. We loved it so much here that we ended up sleeping in late on the morning of our departure even after Kali's wake-up call and almost missing our train. We would have loved to said our thank you's and goodbyes properly (and have that last awesome breakfast too!). It will have to wait til the next time. Definitely A+++++ will do business again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little hotel where there's no limit for the level of service”
Reviews.Author: Cirkeline1980
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the hotel, you can feel the warmth and the friendliness from the people that works there. If you the kind of person that want luxury then go to the hilton, but if you're in Rome to see all the beautifull things this city has to offer, and "just" need a bed to sleep in, and a friendly face that will do everything in there power for you to fell welcome and have a good holiday, then this is the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best 2 star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HugoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, close to the central station and an easy walk to all the sites that you want to take-in in Rome. Our airline had lost our bag and the staff at the hotel were increadable, they pushed the airline in italian to help us recover our bags. The experience in Rome was made enjoyable by the very helpful and friendly staff at the hotel. The room was exceptinaly clean and had all the facilities that you needed. The breakfast was included in the price and the coffee they made was incredible as well as the view from the window. We would recommend it and would stay there again when we visit Rome. looking forward to Retuning to Saturnia

Reviews.Title: “Staff make it difference!”
Reviews.Author: norimba2134
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. It was clean, friendly, perfectly located, and reasonably priced. But for me, the biggest asset of this hotel are the guys of reception. They are lovely!!! It is great to lodge at a hotel in busy Italy and forget about carrying guides... These guys have got all the information on restaurants, events, enotecas, you name it! They are your agenda for the stay!! They know the best places for food, where you want good value or top rated restaurants, they know it all! Dont look for luxury in this hotel, this hotel is to enjoy Rome. Anyway, if you want to stay in the centre this is the cheapest option, and it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertpound
Reviews.Content: I you they have been in this two days. Small but attractive, it dind't miss of any confort .I will also returne in this hotel for the vacations whith my family. A special thanks to Virgilio and whole staff.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the best rewiews!”
Reviews.Author: murphy1204
Reviews.Content: I agree with the best rewiews regarding this hotel. Ok is a two star but don`t believe it. The service and the staff you can compare with a four star hotel. I travel a lot in all world but is hard to find this treatment. Virgilio and Riccardo makes your stay different and charming. A smile everytime at reception from them, that`s seems a good start in the morning. Breakfast over the average with eggs, ham, fresh rolls and croissant, yogurt and lovely home made cakes. Rooms are not so big but confortable and very clean everymorning. The hotel is central located and well connected with the best part of Rome. For sure i recommend this hotel to all people love a friendly stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL WONDERFULL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: martinsado
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel saturnia 5 nights. the hotel which was very clean and comfortable. the breakfast was more adequate and the coffee was great. well virgilio and kali your frout desk is helpfull, provided a map if roma. i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: annakarenina1981
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the hotel Saturnia. Me and my friends enjoyed the pleasant location situated just in the center of the eternal city. Few blocks away you can find lots of good restaurants and nice shops. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was ok. The people at the front desk were very polite and available for all our requests. I really recommend this hotel for those who travel with friends.

Reviews.Title: “All you need....”
Reviews.Author: murshi1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 1 night in Jannuary 2010. This hotel is just within 15 minutes walk from Termini Station in rome, three blocks to the shopping area at Via Nazionale. location is great. The room has new fornitures, with two reading lights by the side of the bed. water for shower is hot and with good pressure. The bathroom is well decorated. Breakfast is of good value, fresh made coffee, boiled brown eggs, pastries, cakes, yogurt, bread, juices and fresh fruits. The receptionist and staff all very enthusiastic to help. We arrived earlier than check-in time and they allowed us to check in early. Also we left hotel before breakfast time at departure but they arranged just for us a full breakfast. we really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “two stars asf our stars”
Reviews.Author: senador
Reviews.Content: In a historical building a few distance of via nazionale ,quirinale and santa maria major justo to have an idea in 15 minutes you can arrive in colosseo.good welcome.Rooms of good comfort,clean,quiet and superior expresso at breakfast.the staff was friendly and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very well located”
Reviews.Author: shinyshiny33
Reviews.Content: We had a fairly pleasant stay at the hotel Saturnia. The decor was appealing and breakfast was delicious. We were made to feel at home as soon as we arrived, the hotel is very comfortable and clean, our room was great. The hotel is full of old furniture and interesting ornaments....paintings are greats. Excellent base for touring the city. Happy and cooperative English speaking staff made email bookings and personal enquiries a delight. All in all we were very satisfied with our stay - especially considering the fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and efficient!”
Reviews.Author: petery1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Saturnia for the last ofthe year. I am very familiar with Rome and I have stayed in several more blazoned hotels and was pleasantly surprised by the size and furnishing of the room (simple yet elegant) by a very modern and well equipped bath room and especially by the manager Virgilio who was very attentive and did everything possible to make our stay a remarkable experience. Situated about ten minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and about the same to the Spanish Steps and also to the nearest metro station Cavour. Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Homely feel”
Reviews.Author: prashant_gov
Reviews.Content: I was totally new to Rome when I booked this hotel . With a thought to just sleep at night we thought its good in that price. But i reached there and developed the personal interaction with Hotel staff, I came with wonderful memories. I feel like I was at my home. The atomsphare was completely homely . everything was filled with emotions. wehn we were about to vacate the place i left with reomrse that I did not know much Mr. Virgilio . A grea human being , passion for art and serving people by working in hotel industry. I hope any body who would like to go visit rome have a trial there. i can surely say you will not feel its a hotel, but for sure you will receive a essence of home . love affection. In fine I can only say A small wonderful cottage with very close emotional bonding. Note: Do not miss to explore Mr. Virgilio . From out side he is just handeling a front desk but if you dig inside him he is a great painter(You can see his painting all around the hotel reception area, dining area and 1st floor), A great human being and a perfectionist. Prashant India

Reviews.Title: “Good quality/price relation, clean and very well located”
Reviews.Author: Amy2999
Reviews.Content: It is a good choice for those aiming to visit Rome historical centre with a low budget and without a car, because it is just in the city centre, only five minutes walking from the railway station and at walking distance to some of the main tourist attractions. It is basic (some of the bedrooms don´t have private WC, some others do have) but the rooms are clean, it is quiet, the service is correct, rooms are properly equipped (they have everything which is neccessary) and the included breakfast is more than good for the price. Summarizing: good quality/price relation.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what you think it will be like”
Reviews.Author: caleypl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room which was recently re-furbished, it was a pretty good room. We enjoyed staying at this hotel. The breakfast was good, nothing out of the ordinary for Italy, ham and cheese. This location was close to Central Termini the train station, about 10 minute walk. There are no good places to eat around here, you will need to walk to get to good places, as all the restaurants around this hotel are tourist traps! Otherwise good stay. The free internet was good as well, but we had to ask for it, and it doesn't work in your room the wireless connection only works in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsgo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Quiet, safe, confidential....we spent there five unforgettable days. Very friendly and helpful staff. We are planning to come back next year in may with our friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: beatrix4819
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice located close to all monuments and to metro station "Cavour". All staff very helpful. Rooms clean everyday and spacious. Excellent breakfast in the morning. Recommendable

Reviews.Title: “great staff, poor rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: travellingisliving
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in nov. 2009. We arrived by bus from the airport to central station and it was easy to find (we had our own map and checked the address in advance). The location was very nice: we easily reached the colosseo and many others sightseeings by feet; there were to metro stations 5-10 minutes walking distance, one of them in the central station. The staff of the hotel was nice as well, helpful and friendly, from the receptionists to the cleaning ladies. The breakfast was good and satisfactory. The room was bit disappointing. When we arrived we slept in a very small room with a tiny bathroom. We asked to get a new one and without problems we got a bigger room with bathroom inside (there was the shower and the sink inside the room without any wall of separation) and the toilet was outside on the floor (common toilet). We managed of course with the second room - it was better and definetly less cloustrofobic. The rooms and the rest of the hotel were cleaned, but it didn't look like the building is well taken care of. I can recommend to sleep here if it is for a short stay as we did (4-5 nights).

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: itsbritbiotch
Reviews.Content: The staff was soooo helpful! I miss them. The hotel itself is with in walking distance of many attractions. I hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very convinient.”
Reviews.Author: federick81
Reviews.Content: Roma is fantastic. the staff is wonderful. Great maneger!

Reviews.Title: “CHECKED IN AT 2 STARS, CHECKED OUT AT 5 STARS”
Reviews.Author: OOFA2
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin? I only have positive things to say! Well, me and 2 other girls stayed in the triple room. Small, but served the purpose of a trip to Rome which was a bed to sleep on and a shower to clean up! Shower is really small, so if you are of an larger size it maybe tight. We arrived to the hotel via shared shuttle service about 6 hours prior to check in and they greeted us with a cup of coffee while we waited maybe 30 minutes for our room to be ready. Allowed us to check in early which was great after a long flight. Great location and you could walk to ALL the main attractions. We actually walked all the way to the vatican! What a great way to see the beautiful city of Rome. Very safe area for hotel location, food and basically anything else you need. Hotel staff was great. Loved, Loved, Loved the gentlemen that worked the night shift. What talent he has!!! All the paintings you see in the hotel he did himself! My girlfriend didn't have a european adapter for a 3 prong for her computer and the staff went and bought one for her to use and said they should have one at the hotel anyways for future guests!!! OMG!! How fantastic is that?? Breakfast was plentiful and simple beverages were always available for free. I would highly recommend this place and plan on coming back! I got a big hug good bye and kind of got teary eyed to say good bye to the wonderful staff. The bond was immediate! Great shopping, so bring some extra bucks girls! Public transportation was fairly simple as well. No wash clothes, so bring a spongy for the shower. Rooms were quiet only heard the noise of other guests once in awhile. The only thing I think needs attention would be: Needs to add some fresh fruit for breakfast Give public transportation directions on the confirmation email when booking the hotel I give this hotel high scores!!!

Reviews.Title: “I feel like home”
Reviews.Author: chrisyer
Reviews.Content: I had nice time staying in that hotel and the people working there Virgilio and Ricardo as also the other staff makes me feel like i was at my house. Theeir service was excelent and always try to help and answer to all my questions. The breakfast the rooms are excelent. I dont have other words to describe it and of course when am back in Rome am sure i return back. The only must improve the internet and also have a good wi-fi also to the rooms. All the other are excelent!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful magic staff with a heart”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirl6
Reviews.Content: I had doubts when my friend wrinz asked me this hotel without the lift. I concerned but not yet booked entrusted me with good luck. When we arrived at the airport it started raining, and this seemed to be not a good sign. arrival at the hotel I was impressed by the availability of goalkeeper who offered us two hot cup of tea while he was a Checkin . when we went down there showed the itinerary of Rome by telling a story of this magic city!, providing information on how to move and restaurants catering to our needs. He was very kind . We were very sad when we were going.Good breakfast, rooms very clean. You will find a the staf of dream , when you arrive to find him. small hotel but with a great service, good as in a great hotel! thanks to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “little hotel in Rome city center”
Reviews.Author: marlyn1467
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located. Room are comfortable but not so big. Breakfast in the morning was rich with ham, cheese, fresh croissant, rolls and fresh fruit every morning. If we came back to Rome we definetely stay there. Thanks to Kali.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mincigirl1981
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for only one night on the internet but at least i decided to spend there three nights more. This was because the hotel was more than i expected. Very clean room, nice staff, great and quiet position and all new furnished. Don't believe to all rewiews my experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: pavoneblu
Reviews.Content: My favorite part about this hotel was the concierge at the front desk. Immediately upon arrival he answered all of our questions and gave us a fantastic map. Every day when we left, the person at the front desk would explain in detail how to get where. Breakfast was great, lots of options, good service. Room was a good size, the shower was IN the room, which I thought was odd, but it worked out for us, maybe not for some people. No private bathrooms on the floor we stayed - if that is a problem for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything nice”
Reviews.Author: losamigos1973
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnai is a two star hotel but everything was really nice....consider it as minimum a three star! Room is good and cleaning was really the best i've found in Italy. I saw not good review on internet connection but they change it for sure, mine was excellent. Breakfast in high standard. The staff help you in any case you need, ok maibe english is not perfect with all of them but this is not a good matter for a two star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff.... how to visit Rome in the best way”
Reviews.Author: silverblaze1972
Reviews.Content: First of all we just arrived early in the morning in this small quiet hotel and they gave us our room at 10 a.m., we were very tired and this was a very good service.They also offered us an extra buffet breakfast at the arrival time. Riccardo at the front desk helped us in finding out everything we were looking for also arranging for us a tour of the city at a very fair price. Room was new furnished and the bathroom was spacious and clean. Fresh towels every day. Virgilio in the evening shift always suggested us not touristic and very good restaurants. We definetely recommend this hotel to whom doesn't need a five star hotel but want to visit Rome in the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what i expected”
Reviews.Author: patapata19
Reviews.Content: A little gem in Rome. Hotel has some rennovations in common areas and for sure in our room. Nothing compares with some old reviews i've read before booking. Comfortable room with nice new bathroom and all amenities. English speaking staff always helped us to find everything in the city and very good suggestions for restaurants and sightseeng. Breakfast in the morning was rich. Room cleaning and fresh towels every day. we definetely recommend this hotel for a nice stay in the center of Rome close to all monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: RubblesAuckland
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday afternoon after driving up from Sorrento. We had no idea where we were and had nothing booked. Riccardo was on the desk and assured us we were in the centre of Rome and booked us in for 4 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. We were able to walk to the Colesseum, the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and lots of other attractions easily. The train station was a 5 minute walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast provided was plenty to start the day off. Anytime of the day were were able to help ourselves to coffee. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: global_food
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnia is clean, comfortable and centrally located. We stayed at Hotel Saturnia on 2 separate nights (when we arrived in Italy and on our last night). The hotel is close to the central train station (10 min walk) and many other sights (Roman Forum, Coliseum). Breakfast is included in the rate. The staff at the hotel is extremely helpful. They stored our luggage when we arrived early, provided maps/directions to where we were going, and Riccardo helped us ship our package back home!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: lloydkristy
Reviews.Content: i've been travelling in Rome with my wife and we found this beautiful hotel down town very close to piazza di spagna and piazza navona.i found the stuff very helpfull the breakfast was very good and the rooms very confortable i really recommend it even the price is quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bhornet_1046
Reviews.Content: After touring Rome and viewing all it has to offer, it was comforting to know that we could relax in the comfortable rooms we rented. We originally planned on staying for two nights. After such wonderful rest in the comfortable beds and friendly hotel staff, we decided to remain for another 4 nights. We highly recommend those viewing other hotels to consider this hidden jewel within easy walking distance to some of the best sights and public transportation in Rome. It was an easy walk from the Metro Station to the hotel after we quickly learned our way around the city. We're booking again for our next vacation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mike_8530
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Saturnia in late August 2009. Booked via the website without issue. The hotel is nicely located about 9 blocks from Stazione Termini, and a few blocks from Cavour subway station. The neighbourhood is safe and it's quiet in the rooms because the hotel is located on a short street off Cavour. I arrived on an extremely hot day, and after checking-in & realising that I had one of the 'basic' rooms without A/C or private bath, I returned to the desk where I was helpfully offered an upgrade for an additional €20 per night. This second room did have A/C, a small private bathroom, and a generally improved finish over the basic room. (Having now returned and re-consulted my original booking, it seems as though I did in fact book the upgraded room to begin with, so not sure why I had to pay the extra on arrival. Water under the bridge - this was still a cheap stay.) The rooms were clean, and although there was a bit of mildew around the shower door as others have described, it's nothing to get excited about. As the private bathroom is small, and has to include a bidet, the shower is therefore quite tiny (one thing it could benefit from would be a shelf to put soap/shampoo on). I can't imagine anyone even remotely obese being able to use it. The bed was certainly not the most comfortable I have used, but it did the job. Some of the reviews have mentioned the staff, and I have to give a shout-out to Riccardo. He was always smiling, welcoming and spoke English quite well. He also set me up at a neighbouring hotel during the following week when I would be back in Rome and Saturnia was fully booked. Although lacking in some minor details, Saturnia is a good hotel, well-located, reasonably-priced, and with a pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “comfort”
Reviews.Author: romesammy
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel ,rome downtown,staff very polite.Very good breackfast .5 min from the railway station. Comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: solvinyuu
Reviews.Content: I spent there five nights for a meeting in Rome and i was luky to find this place. My room was really quiet and good air conditioning, important in August. Cleaning everyday. Excellent breakfast in the morning eggs, ham all kind of croissant marmellade and juice and for sure wonderful espresso coffee, i love it. People at reception very friendly and professional, they try to do the best for sure. But the best is the location. You can go walking everywhere Trevi , Spanish steps, Colosseo and Vatican, really nice location. I recommend this hotel to everyone want to be central located in Rome (that is for sure important) and to everyone want a clean and nyce room paying a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff, great customer service and a fabolous location!”
Reviews.Author: EcoBee
Reviews.Content: This Hotel in the heart of Rome is small, old and needs renovation - no doubt about it! But the exceptional friendliness and determination of the Saturnia staff members to make your stay as pleasant as possible makes up for it! The Hotel is especially great located. Only a 5 minutes walk to Termini Station were one can reach any bus, train or metro but also walking distance to the Collosseum and many other interesting sites. Also right there are small convenient stores, good and economic pizza and food take out places as well as many restaurants and evening entertainment. The Hotel is as i mentioned old and really needs a make over. It does not have an elevator and the bathrooms are shared. The rooms are small, basic and simple but are clean. We had fresh towels every day! The first night i stayed in a single room which was very small and i would recommend to book a double even if you travel alone. After that we had a double room in the 4th floor with pretty steep stairs, but the room was very nice, had it's own bathroom and terrasse with a view over Rome. Breakfast was included and we were pleasantly surprised about the variety of cereals, breds, even mortadella, eggs and cheese as well as juices. Wireless internet signal was free of charge but the connection is not always good. Parking is a challenge around the hotel as the streets are very narrow but valet parking is available from the hotel for a few euros. Best of all - the staff members of the Hotel are real gems! One morning i had to leave at 5am for a business meeting and even tho the breakfast is served from 7am, the night concierge prepared the full breakfast just for me. Kali "Banderas" :-) the daytime concierge went more than once out of his way to research transportation options and other inquiries for us! I have to travel frequently to Italy and the next time in Rome, i will for sure stay at the Saturnia again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaratheTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be fabulous for the money we spent. I am a travel agent so I know that you usually get what you pay for- but I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Location: Great. Close to Termini station. Jump on the Leonardo Express from the airport to Termini Station and it is not hard to find from there. It is down an alley way (not 'dodgy' as some suggest). 10-15 min walk to Colosseum. Rooms: We booked a shared bathroom room but we lucky enough to get an upgrade the first night to a room with bathroom. The room was clean, modern and very spacious. The bathroom was newly updated. Although the bathroom was small it was everything we needed. The second room we had was also fine. Although not as modern, it was still spacious and clean. The A/C in both rooms was perfect for the hot days. Our rooms were very quiet and the beds were comfortable. We slept very well! Staff: Friendly and helpful when we needed it. Breakfast: The best we had on our whole Europe trip. They had a great selection- eggs, ham, rolls, cereal, juice and best of all specially made coffees/tea. Shared facilities: Not the greatest, but still bearable. The shared bathroom wasn't upgraded which wasn't really a problem. The only thing was the shower door/cover was a little faulty, but we didn't care. There are no lifts so you do have to lug your bags up the stairs, but this is pretty normal in Europe. All in all, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. If you are expecting the Ritz then you should stay somewhere else. This is a budget hotel, so you if are aware of this you will have a fabulous time!!

Reviews.Title: “i love it . It`s very nice”
Reviews.Author: veroon
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, nice rooms, very helpful staff well located close to the station and close to coluseum. certainly advisable to hotel we love it . very clean and were cleaned every day. very good breakfast i love it. Its very nice

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room of our two week trip to Europe!!!”
Reviews.Author: shellysumit
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online after reading a lot of good reviews for it. After staying in 6 good hotels in Switzerland and Venice, when we reached Rome, we were not expecting such a shock. The hotel wasn't very far from the Termini (train station), which was a good thing. But if you have luggade, then its best to take a cab, its still a good 10- 15 minute walk to it. The lobby of the hotel was very nice and the guy at reception seemed nice too. When we said we were on our honeymoon, he assured that he given us one of their best rooms. The room he gave us was on 2nd floor (2nd in Europe is 3rd in US), and there was no elevator so we had to lug our luggage all the way up. The room was really small, with the bathroom so small that it was impossible to stand and brush at the sink. The toilet seat had a crack in it. Believe me, we had been to small family owned B&B rooms which were much bigger than this room. There was one far to reach window, which was closed. Their was no ventilation in the room. And the sheets smelled of dust. The breakfast was average, what we had been getting everywhere else. The staff was helpful only to a certain extent. After telling you one thing, if you asked a few more questions, they would curtly reply that its best we find it ourselves. We won't recommend this to anyone. Its not that it was very cheap hotel that we wouldnt mind staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good wee cheap hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sobaan
Reviews.Content: For a 2 star hotel,i was very suprised, the customer service of the staff was great especially Virgilio, who was vey helpful. Location of this hotel is fantastic smack bang in the city centre, close to all the main attractions. The hotel advertises shared bathrooms but i had a room for four and we had own bathroom which was great for us. The price also meant this no frills hotel showed good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good staff, perfect as a place to stay will sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ploftusDC
Reviews.Content: Only a 10 min walk from Termini Station and easy to find. The area seemed perfectly safe. About a 10-12 min walk from the Fora Romano and Imperilli and Trevi Fountain. There is a nice gelato place just a block down on Via Cavour. Staff speak English and her accomodating. They are perfectly content with letting you come and go as you please. Breakfast is nice and adequate, continental style. You can walk to many of the city's sights and a metro stop is about a 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “They made a spontaneous arrival in the city so easy!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl6789
Reviews.Content: The desk staff for the three hotels in this group - in particular, the staff at Saturnia and the Fellini - were wonderfully accommodating! They worked to find available rooms when we appeared without a reservation; they stowed our gear when we took at overnight jaunt to the coast, and the two restaurant recommendations they gave were the best two meals we had in Rome - and the most affordable ones, too!

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: some_trekkers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by wandering into it when we were in Rome, exasperated that we could not find a reasonable place to stay. It turned out to be a fantastic discovery for us. The thing that makes this hotel is its kind, generous and helpful staff--which can be a big bonus after a long day of being shuffled here and there in an unfamiliar and sometimes unwelcoming new city for a tourist. We were pleased by the breakfast selections, as well. It's not a fancy place, but it's comfortable and again, smartly staffed. We were so happy with our hotel that we actually planned the remainder of our stay in Italy around staying here because we felt like we were getting such a good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the website!!”
Reviews.Author: sianydahling
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia is in a great location (although it is down a dodgy alley of the main road!!), however do not be conned by the website, I do not believe the rooms they have pictures of are actually in this hotel!! If you are looking for a cheap and basic place to crash then this is ideal but I wouldn't plan to spend any time here other than to sleep as it wasn't particularly clean and the room was very small and cramped!! I have stayed in hostels that are more luxurious!!

Reviews.Title: “Family running hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverblaze72
Reviews.Content: What a nice place to live Rome! We spent there one week and we really feel like home. This place is managed from a family, they told us, so everything is well done. They take care about clean, about breakfast (fresh croissant and rolls every morning, ham, cheese, fresh fruit, yogurt and homemade cake) so they doesn't leave nothing casually. Room are good, is a renovated 2 star hotel so is fine to stay in Rome (consider you don't stay in room many time) and for sure is clean (we didn't understand the reviews saying is not clean, anyway we found this place more clean than avg). The staff was ok, they help you with maps and suggestion for restaurant and museum, all what we needed. But the best quality of Saturnia is the location.....remember location location location!!! Is located in a very little street walking distance from all you need. You can forget the bus and the metro if you like walking, like us. Just in case to go to Vatican you can take metro, but for the rest forget it. And also is near the station but not in the station area, so we find this location perfect for all the week spent there. We definetely recommend this place to all people want save money choosing a good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Please with Hotel, Great Location, Nice Room and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JoirishSligo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in September, after doing alot of research on hotels in Rome that were in our budget (€80 per night), this was the best option I found. Reviews were varied on alot of sights so I was a bit worried but for the price I couldn't resist, €80 B&B for a shared facilities room. The hotel turned out to be great, very central-less than a 5 minute walk to Termini and a 10 minute walk to the Collesseum. The hotel is located on a busy road but the small road at the back of the hotel is great with loads of small bars and restaurants. Our bedroom was newly decorated with sink, TV and minibar! The bed was comfy and the bathroom was only down the hall with a great shower and seemed to be free most of the time. The only drawback was the road - Via Cavour was quiet loud but because we had a ceiling fan we could close the window/doors which were double glazed and blocked out most of the noise. Breakfast was one of the best we had in our 2 weeks in Italy, the cappucinos are great, however I would avoid the eggs-they do seems to be left there overnight. There is cereal which I didn't get in anyother place I stayed in Italy. I would definatley go back to this hotel as you cannot beat the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLance
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night to catch a flight the next day. It was cheap and clean and very central. HOWEVER- our room face Via Cavour and was so noisy that I didn't sleep. So it could be fine- could be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: dominz6841
Reviews.Content: We booked on internet and we didn´t realize how was central located this Hotel. You can walk all Rome from there. Room was ok, basic but new forniture and not too big but ok. Breakfast was more than the average, eggs, several juice, rolls, ham, salami, fruit, yogurt and croissant. But the staff make your stay special. They explain all about Rome and you can join all the city with their suggestion.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Saturnia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ruinaglia 4/6, 00184 Rome, Italy
